       </sup>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Radio">
       Radio
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Radio">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <p>
      Beginning in March 1945, Batman and Robin made regular appearances on the
      <a href="/wiki/Radio_drama" title="Radio drama">
       radio drama
      </a>
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Adventures_of_Superman_(radio)" title="The Adventures of Superman (radio)">
        The Adventures of Superman
       </a>
      </i>
      on the
      <a href="/wiki/Mutual_Broadcasting_System" title="Mutual Broadcasting System">
       Mutual Broadcasting System
      </a>
      . Efforts were made to launch a Batman radio series in 1943 and again in 1950, but neither came to fruition.
     </p>
     <p>
      In 1989, an original radio drama,
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Lazarus_Syndrome" title="Batman: The Lazarus Syndrome">
        Batman: The Lazarus Syndrome
       </a>
      </i>
      , was produced by
      <a href="/wiki/Dirk_Maggs" title="Dirk Maggs">
       Dirk Maggs
      </a>
      for
      <a href="/wiki/BBC_Radio_4" title="BBC Radio 4">
       BBC Radio 4
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      A second Maggs production aired on
      <a href="/wiki/BBC_Radio_1" title="BBC Radio 1">
       BBC Radio 1
      </a>
      in 1994, this time adapting the comic book storyline
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Knightfall#Radio" title="Batman: Knightfall">
        Batman: Knightfall
       </a>
      </i>
      . It was adapted, produced and directed by Maggswith music composed by
      <a href="/wiki/Mark_Russell" title="Mark Russell">
       Mark Russell
      </a>
      who had also made
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Superman:_Doomsday_%26_Beyond" title="Superman: Doomsday &amp; Beyond">
        Superman: Doomsday &amp; Beyond
       </a>
      </i>
      on
      <a href="/wiki/BBC_Radio_5_Live" title="BBC Radio 5 Live">
       BBC Radio 5
      </a>
      . This show, however was not commissioned of its own, but rather to be three-minute episodes on the Mark Goodier Show. This meant it was written with a sense of immediacy; having to make an instant effect and each three-minute segment contains a major plot development or sound effect stunt and ends on a cliffhanger. DC acknowledged the effort in an issue
      <i>
       Shadow of The Bat
      </i>
      by having villains jump past a sign reading "Dirk Maggs Radio".
      <a href="/wiki/Michael_Gough" title="Michael Gough">
       Michael Gough
      </a>
      reprised the role of
      <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Pennyworth" title="Alfred Pennyworth">
       Alfred Pennyworth
      </a>
      from the Burton/Schumacher film series.
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Television">
       Television
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Television">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Live_action">
       Live action
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Live action">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       19661968:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_(TV_series)" title="Batman (TV series)">
         Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       starring
       <a href="/wiki/Adam_West" title="Adam West">
        Adam West
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Burt_Ward" title="Burt Ward">
        Burt Ward
       </a>
       as Bruce Wayne/Batman and Dick Grayson/Robin
      </li>
      <li>
       1972: "Equal pay"
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Public_Service_Announcement" title="Public Service Announcement">
        Public Service Announcement
       </a>
       featuring
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dick_Gautier" title="Dick Gautier">
        Dick Gautier
       </a>
       as Batman, Burt Ward as Robin, and Yvonne Craig as Batgirl
      </li>
      <li>
       1979:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Legends_of_the_Superheroes" title="Legends of the Superheroes">
         Legends of the Superheroes
        </a>
       </i>
       by Hanna Barbera, featuring West and Ward as Batman and Robin
      </li>
      <li>
       2001: "
       <a href="/wiki/OnStar" title="OnStar">
        OnStar
       </a>
       " commercials featuring
       <a href="/wiki/Bruce_Thomas_(actor)" title="Bruce Thomas (actor)">
        Bruce Thomas
       </a>
       as Batman and
       <a href="/wiki/Michael_Gough" title="Michael Gough">
        Michael Gough
       </a>
       as Alfred, and followed the visual style of the 19891997 film series
      </li>
      <li>
       2002:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Birds_of_Prey_(TV_series)" title="Birds of Prey (TV series)">
         Birds of Prey
        </a>
       </i>
       , TV series that featured Batman in the first episode, Bruce Thomas reprises his role as Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2011:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Smallville" title="Smallville">
         Smallville
        </a>
       </i>
       : Veiled references to both Batman and
       <a href="/wiki/Wonder_Woman" title="Wonder Woman">
        Wonder Woman
       </a>
       are made by
       <a href="/wiki/Chloe_Sullivan" title="Chloe Sullivan">
        Chloe Sullivan
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       2014:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Flash_(2014_TV_series)" title="The Flash (2014 TV series)">
         The Flash
        </a>
       </i>
       :
       <a href="/wiki/Wayne_Enterprises" title="Wayne Enterprises">
        Wayne Tech
       </a>
       , owned by billionaire Bruce Wayne a.k.a. Batman, is referred to in a Central City Citizen news article detailing its merger with rival company,
       <a href="/wiki/Queen_Industries" title="Queen Industries">
        Queen Incorporated
       </a>
       , owned by Oliver Queen, better known as the superhero,
       <a href="/wiki/Green_Arrow" title="Green Arrow">
        Green Arrow
       </a>
       , in the year 2024.
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h4>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Bruce_Wayne">
       <i>
        Bruce Wayne
       </i>
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Bruce Wayne">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h4>
     <p>
      In 1999,
      <a href="/wiki/Tim_McCanlies" title="Tim McCanlies">
       Tim McCanlies
      </a>
      wrote a pilot script and series bible for a planned series called
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Bruce_Wayne_(TV_series)" title="Bruce Wayne (TV series)">
        Bruce Wayne
       </a>
      </i>
      to be produced by Tollin/Robbins Productions. Taking place in his teenage years, the series would cover his passage into young adulthood, training, and development into becoming Batman. Other characters would include Alfred, Sergeant Jim Gordon, law school student Harvey Dent, and a seductive young Selina Kyle. Planned to run for five to six seasons, it would show how he acquired his martial arts skills, his equipment, and detective abilities he would use in his war on crime. It would also focus on topics such as corruption within the board of Wayne Enterprises (an element which found its way into the movie
      <i>
       Batman Begins
      </i>
      , to some extent) and police affiliation with the mafia.
      <i>
       Bruce Wayne
      </i>
      was nearing pre-production when
      <a href="/wiki/Warner_Bros." title="Warner Bros.">
       Warner Bros.
      </a>
      movie division felt it would conflict with the planned
      <i>
       Year One
      </i>
      movie and scrapped it. The result was
      <i>
       Batman Begins
      </i>
      and Tollin/Robbins Productions later went to create
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Smallville" title="Smallville">
        Smallville
       </a>
      </i>
      , a series about a teenage Clark Kent.
     </p>
     <h4>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Gotham">
       <i>
        Gotham
       </i>
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Gotham">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h4>
     <p>
      Warner Bros. Television and
      <a href="/wiki/Fox_Broadcasting_Company" title="Fox Broadcasting Company">
       Fox
      </a>
      are working on a TV series titled
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Gotham_(TV_series)" title="Gotham (TV series)">
        Gotham
       </a>
      </i>
      with
      <a href="/wiki/Bruno_Heller" title="Bruno Heller">
       Bruno Heller
      </a>
      created the show and will focus on James Gordon as a detective and solving Thomas and Martha Wayne's murder.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3">
       <a href="#cite_note-3">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        3
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4">
       <a href="#cite_note-4">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        4
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      The pilot is plan to start filming in March 2014 and will feature Bruce Wayne at 12 years old. Fox chairman
      <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Reilly_(executive)" title="Kevin Reilly (executive)">
       Kevin Reilly
      </a>
      also revealed that the series will have an origin story of Wayne becoming Batman in the final episode, origins stories for Riddler, Penguin, Joker and Catwoman and the series will may have a similar tone to the Christopher Nolan Batman films.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5">
       <a href="#cite_note-5">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        5
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6">
       <a href="#cite_note-6">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        6
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-7">
       <a href="#cite_note-7">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        7
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-collider_8-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-collider-8">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        8
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-9">
       <a href="#cite_note-9">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        9
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Danny_Cannon" title="Danny Cannon">
       Danny Cannon
      </a>
      will direct the pilot and executive produce the series and an order of 16 episodes.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-collider_8-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-collider-8">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        8
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10">
       <a href="#cite_note-10">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        10
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Actor
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ben_McKenzie" title="Ben McKenzie">
       Ben McKenzie
      </a>
      has been cast as Gordon while the young Bruce is portrayed by
      <a href="/wiki/David_Mazouz" title="David Mazouz">
       David Mazouz
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11">
       <a href="#cite_note-11">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        11
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12">
       <a href="#cite_note-12">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        12
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Animated">
       Animated
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Animated">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       196869:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Batman/Superman_Hour" title="The Batman/Superman Hour">
         The Batman/Superman Hour
        </a>
       </i>
       , produced by
       <a href="/wiki/Filmation" title="Filmation">
        Filmation
       </a>
       ; featured Batman in
       <i>
        Batman with Robin the Boy Wonder
       </i>
       segments. Batman segments were later repackaged as
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Adventures_of_Batman" title="The Adventures of Batman">
         The Adventures of Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       and
       <i>
        Batman with Robin the Boy Wonder
       </i>
       . In this cartoon, Batman is voiced by
       <a href="/wiki/Olan_Soule" title="Olan Soule">
        Olan Soule
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       1970: Batman appears in three animated educational shorts as part of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Sesame_Street" title="Sesame Street">
         Sesame Street
        </a>
        '
       </i>
       s first season. Olan Soule reprises as Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       1972:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_New_Scooby-Doo_Movies" title="The New Scooby-Doo Movies">
         The New Scooby-Doo Movies
        </a>
       </i>
       , produced by
       <a href="/wiki/Hanna-Barbera" title="Hanna-Barbera">
        Hanna-Barbera
       </a>
       ; Batman and Robin appeared in episodes "The Dynamic Scooby-Doo Affair" (9/16/72) and "The Caped Crusader Caper" (12/16/72), where Olan Soule first reprises his role as the Caped Crusader.
      </li>
     </ul>
     <div class="thumb tright">
      <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
       <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:New_Scooby_Doo_Movies_Batman.JPG">
        <img alt="The title card has the show title at the top and Shaggy, holding a flashlight, and Scooby-Doo in the lower left. To the right, in the light from the flashlight, is shown Batman and Robin." class="thumbimage" data-file-height="225" data-file-width="300" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/07/New_Scooby_Doo_Movies_Batman.JPG/220px-New_Scooby_Doo_Movies_Batman.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/07/New_Scooby_Doo_Movies_Batman.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/07/New_Scooby_Doo_Movies_Batman.JPG 2x" width="220"/>
       </a>
       <div class="thumbcaption">
        <div class="magnify">
         <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:New_Scooby_Doo_Movies_Batman.JPG" title="Enlarge">
         </a>
        </div>
        Title card for The Dynamic Duo's guest shots on
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/The_New_Scooby-Doo_Movies" title="The New Scooby-Doo Movies">
          The New Scooby-Doo Movies
         </a>
        </i>
        in 1972
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <ul>
      <li>
       197386: Various
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Super_Friends" title="Super Friends">
         Super Friends
        </a>
       </i>
       series produced by Hanna-Barbera; Olan Soule again reprises his role as Batman in all but the last two
       <i>
        Super Friends
       </i>
       series, where he is replaced by
       <a href="/wiki/Adam_West" title="Adam West">
        Adam West
       </a>
       <ul>
        <li>
         197374:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Super_Friends_(1973_TV_series)" title="Super Friends (1973 TV series)">
           Super Friends
          </a>
         </i>
        </li>
        <li>
         197778:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/The_All-New_Super_Friends_Hour" title="The All-New Super Friends Hour">
           The All-New Super Friends Hour
          </a>
         </i>
        </li>
        <li>
         197879:
         <i>
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Challenge_of_the_SuperFriends" title="Challenge of the SuperFriends">
           Challenge of the SuperFriends
          </a>
         </i>
        </li>
        <li>
         197980:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/The_World%27s_Greatest_Super_Friends" title="The World's Greatest Super Friends">
           The World's Greatest Super Friends
          </a>
         </i>
        </li>
        <li>
         198083:
         <i>
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Super_Friends_(1980)" title="Super Friends (1980)">
           Super Friends
          </a>
         </i>
        </li>
        <li>
         198485:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Super_Friends:_The_Legendary_Super_Powers_Show" title="Super Friends: The Legendary Super Powers Show">
           Super Friends: The Legendary Super Powers Show
          </a>
         </i>
        </li>
        <li>
         198586:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/The_Super_Powers_Team:_Galactic_Guardians" title="The Super Powers Team: Galactic Guardians">
           The Super Powers Team: Galactic Guardians
          </a>
         </i>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       197778:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_New_Adventures_of_Batman" title="The New Adventures of Batman">
         The New Adventures of Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       , produced by Filmation; while the H-B produced
       <i>
        Super Friends
       </i>
       ran on ABC, Adam West and
       <a href="/wiki/Burt_Ward" title="Burt Ward">
        Burt Ward
       </a>
       (Robin) voiced their previously live-action roles for this CBS cartoon series; later rerun as part of
       <i>
        The Batman/Tarzan Adventure Hour
       </i>
       (the Tarzan segments had also been previously seen as their own series)
      </li>
      <li>
       19922006: The
       <a href="/wiki/DC_animated_universe" title="DC animated universe">
        DC animated universe
       </a>
       produced by
       <a href="/wiki/Warner_Bros._Animation" title="Warner Bros. Animation">
        Warner Bros. Animation
       </a>
       ; Batman is voiced by
       <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Conroy" title="Kevin Conroy">
        Kevin Conroy
       </a>
       in all appearances
      </li>
     </ul>
     <div class="thumb tright">
      <div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;">
       <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:DCAU_batsuits.jpg">
        <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="158" data-file-width="300" height="132" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/04/DCAU_batsuits.jpg/250px-DCAU_batsuits.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/04/DCAU_batsuits.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/04/DCAU_batsuits.jpg 2x" width="250"/>
       </a>
       <div class="thumbcaption">
        <div class="magnify">
         <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:DCAU_batsuits.jpg" title="Enlarge">
         </a>
        </div>
        Batman's various designs from the
        <a href="/wiki/DC_animated_universe" title="DC animated universe">
         DCAU
        </a>
        .
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <ul>
        <li>
         199295:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Animated_Series" title="Batman: The Animated Series">
           Batman: The Animated Series
          </a>
         </i>
         ; the first series of the DCAU
        </li>
        <li>
         199799:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Superman:_The_Animated_Series" title="Superman: The Animated Series">
           Superman: The Animated Series
          </a>
         </i>
         ; Batman guest stars in "World's Finest", "Knight Time" and "The Demon Reborn"
        </li>
        <li>
         199799:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/The_New_Batman_Adventures" title="The New Batman Adventures">
           The New Batman Adventures
          </a>
         </i>
         ; a continuation of
         <i>
          Batman: The Animated Series
         </i>
        </li>
        <li>
         19992001:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Batman_Beyond" title="Batman Beyond">
           Batman Beyond
          </a>
         </i>
         ; an elderly Bruce Wayne passes the mantle of Batman onto teenager
         <a href="/wiki/Batman_(Terry_McGinnis)" title="Batman (Terry McGinnis)">
          Terry McGinnis
         </a>
         (voiced by
         <a href="/wiki/Will_Friedle" title="Will Friedle">
          Will Friedle
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         2001:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/The_Zeta_Project" title="The Zeta Project">
           The Zeta Project
          </a>
         </i>
         ; the future Batman guest stars in the episode "Shadows"
        </li>
        <li>
         200104:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Justice_League_(TV_series)" title="Justice League (TV series)">
           Justice League
          </a>
         </i>
         ; the original Batman becomes one of the founding members of the League. This series does not include Robin. A romantic relationship with Wonder Woman is implied.
        </li>
        <li>
         200204:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Static_Shock" title="Static Shock">
           Static Shock
          </a>
         </i>
         ; Batman guest stars in "The Big Leagues", "Hard as Nails", "A League of Their Own" and "Future Shock"
        </li>
        <li>
         200406:
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Justice_League_Unlimited" title="Justice League Unlimited">
           Justice League Unlimited
          </a>
         </i>
         ; a continuation of
         <i>
          Justice League
         </i>
         . Like the previous series, it does not include Robin and a Batman-Wonder Woman romantic relationship is implied.
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       1997: Appeared in the
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Animaniacs" title="Animaniacs">
         Animaniacs
        </a>
       </i>
       episode "Boo Wonder"; Adam West reprises his role as the Caped Crusader
      </li>
      <li>
       2004:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Teen_Titans_(TV_series)" title="Teen Titans (TV series)">
         Teen Titans
        </a>
       </i>
       ; appears in silhouette in the episode "Haunted", in a flashback sequence
      </li>
      <li>
       200408:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Batman_(TV_series)" title="The Batman (TV series)">
         The Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       ; in this series, Bruce Wayne is a young crime fighter just three years into his career as Batman. He is voiced by
       <a href="/wiki/Rino_Romano" title="Rino Romano">
        Rino Romano
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       200506: In
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Krypto_the_Superdog" title="Krypto the Superdog">
         Krypto the Superdog
        </a>
       </i>
       , Batman himself makes no appearances, but his pet dog
       <a href="/wiki/Ace_the_Bat-Hound" title="Ace the Bat-Hound">
        Ace the Bat-Hound
       </a>
       does, although Ace prefers to refer to himself as "Batman's partner," rather than his pet
      </li>
      <li>
       200811:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Brave_and_the_Bold" title="Batman: The Brave and the Bold">
         Batman: The Brave and the Bold
        </a>
       </i>
       ; based in part on the comic book series
       <a href="/wiki/The_Brave_and_the_Bold" title="The Brave and the Bold">
        of the same name
       </a>
       , the series has Batman (voiced by
       <a href="/wiki/Diedrich_Bader" title="Diedrich Bader">
        Diedrich Bader
       </a>
       ) team-up with several other
       <a href="/wiki/DC_Comics" title="DC Comics">
        DC Comics
       </a>
       heroes
      </li>
      <li>
       201013:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Young_Justice_(TV_series)" title="Young Justice (TV series)">
         Young Justice
        </a>
       </i>
       ; the animated series of Young Justice features Justice League members as well as Batman voiced by
       <a href="/wiki/Bruce_Greenwood" title="Bruce Greenwood">
        Bruce Greenwood
       </a>
       , who played the role in the animated film
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Under_the_Red_Hood" title="Batman: Under the Red Hood">
         Batman: Under the Red Hood
        </a>
       </i>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13">
        <a href="#cite_note-13">
         <span>
          [
         </span>
         13
         <span>
          ]
         </span>
        </a>
       </sup>
      </li>
      <li>
       2012:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Mad_(TV_series)" title="Mad (TV series)">
         Mad
        </a>
       </i>
       ; when their fellow heroes feel under-appreciated, they appeal to Superman, Batman, and Wonder Woman about being called "Super Friends"
      </li>
      <li>
       2012:
       <a href="/wiki/DC_Nation_Shorts" title="DC Nation Shorts">
        New Teen Titans
       </a>
       short, "Red X Unmasked"; a cameo appearance as one of the people under the mask of Red X and says his famous line from
       <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Animated_Series" title="Batman: The Animated Series">
        Batman: The Animated Series
       </a>
       , "I am Vengeance, I am the Night, I am," but his mask comes off before he can say his name; voiced by
       <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Michael_Richardson" title="Kevin Michael Richardson">
        Kevin Michael Richardson
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       2013:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Teen_Titans_Go!_(TV_series)" title="Teen Titans Go! (TV series)">
         Teen Titans Go!
        </a>
       </i>
       ; he is referenced in episode 1 "Legendary Sandwich" where a cardboard cutout is seen in the supermarket advertising cereal called Bat-O's. This also appears in episode 3 "Drivers Ed". In the same episode Robin is talking to him about the crashed Batmobile on the phone telling him it's just a scratch (and then it blows up). Batman is mentioned by name in episode 4 "Raven's Daddy Dearest" where
       <a href="/wiki/Trigon_(comics)" title="Trigon (comics)">
        Trigon
       </a>
       makes a joke about him. In "La Larva de Amor", Batman and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Commissioner_James_Gordon" title="Commissioner James Gordon">
        Commissioner James Gordon
       </a>
       make a cameo on a fishing boat while Silkie was drifting out to sea. In "Gorilla", when Batman calls the Titans on their holographic message machine, Beast Boy (in his gorilla form) gets into a violent rage from being waken from his nap and smashes the machine. At the end of the episode, Batman calls the Titans again, but Cyborg, Starfire, and Raven are startled by the noise and act like monkeys while smashing the machine again. In "Girl's Night Out", Batman and Commissioner Gordon made another cameo, laughing in a police car parked to an alley. After Starfire, Raven, and Jynx drove past the alley from the police, the two continue laughing. In "You're Fired", when
       <a href="/wiki/Wonder_Twins" title="Wonder Twins">
        Zan
       </a>
       becomes the Teen Titan's receptionist, he receives a phone call from an unknown person asking for Batman. Zan tells him that he should call the Batcave, and when the person asks for the Batcave's number, Zan refuses to tell him. He later receives a call from the same person, asking where to call Batman at, causing Zan to yell out the Batcave. Later, when Zan is on
       <a href="/wiki/Facebook" title="Facebook">
        DCUbook
       </a>
       , he reads Robin's latest status stating, "Fighting Crime Like a Boss." Batman replies, "Good Work, Old Chum." Later, when Beast Boy becomes the new receptionist, he receives a call from the same person that Zan spoke to, so Beast Boy pretends to be Batman and be in the Batcave. In "Matched", when flipping through names on Cyborg's match-making computer program, Robin flips past Batman's name and photo.
      </li>
      <li>
       2013:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Beware_the_Batman" title="Beware the Batman">
         Beware the Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       ; a
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/CGI_animated" title="CGI animated">
        CGI animated
       </a>
       series that features
       <a href="/wiki/Katana_(comics)" title="Katana (comics)">
        Katana
       </a>
       as Batman's sidekick.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14">
        <a href="#cite_note-14">
         <span>
          [
         </span>
         14
         <span>
          ]
         </span>
        </a>
       </sup>
       He is voiced by
       <a href="/wiki/Anthony_Ruivivar" title="Anthony Ruivivar">
        Anthony Ruivivar
       </a>
       .
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Animated_films">
       Animated films
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: Animated films">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Featuring_Batman">
       Featuring Batman
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Featuring Batman">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       1993:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Mask_of_the_Phantasm" title="Batman: Mask of the Phantasm">
         Mask of the Phantasm
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Animated_Series" title="Batman: The Animated Series">
         Batman: The Animated Series
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Conroy" title="Kevin Conroy">
        Kevin Conroy
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       1998:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_%26_Mr._Freeze:_SubZero" title="Batman &amp; Mr. Freeze: SubZero">
         Subzero
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        Batman: The Animated Series
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2000:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_Beyond:_Return_of_the_Joker" title="Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker">
         Return of the Joker
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_Beyond" title="Batman Beyond">
         Batman Beyond
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Will_Friedle" title="Will Friedle">
        Will Friedle
       </a>
       and Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2003:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Mystery_of_the_Batwoman" title="Batman: Mystery of the Batwoman">
         Mystery of the Batwoman
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_New_Batman_Adventures" title="The New Batman Adventures">
         The New Batman Adventures
        </a>
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2005:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Batman_vs._Dracula" title="The Batman vs. Dracula">
         The Batman vs. Dracula
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Batman_(TV_series)" title="The Batman (TV series)">
         The Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Rino_Romano" title="Rino Romano">
        Rino Romano
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2010:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Under_the_Red_Hood" title="Batman: Under the Red Hood">
         Under the Red Hood
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Under_the_Hood" title="Batman: Under the Hood">
         Batman: Under the Hood
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Bruce_Greenwood" title="Bruce Greenwood">
        Bruce Greenwood
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2011:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Year_One_(film)" title="Batman: Year One (film)">
         Year One
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Year_One" title="Batman: Year One">
         Batman: Year One
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Benjamin_McKenzie" title="Benjamin McKenzie">
        Benjamin McKenzie
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2012:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Dark_Knight_Returns_(film)" title="Batman: The Dark Knight Returns (film)">
         The Dark Knight Returns - Part 1
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of the first half of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_Returns" title="The Dark Knight Returns">
         The Dark Knight Returns
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Peter_Weller" title="Peter Weller">
        Peter Weller
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2013:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Dark_Knight_Returns_(film)#Part_2" title="Batman: The Dark Knight Returns (film)">
         The Dark Knight Returns - Part 2
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of the second half of
       <i>
        The Dark Knight Returns
       </i>
       with Peter Weller voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2013:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Lego_Batman:_The_Movie_%E2%80%93_DC_Super_Heroes_Unite" title="Lego Batman: The Movie  DC Super Heroes Unite">
         DC Super Heroes Unite
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Lego_Batman_2:_DC_Super_Heroes" title="Lego Batman 2: DC Super Heroes">
         Lego Batman 2: DC Super Heroes
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Troy_Baker" title="Troy Baker">
        Troy Baker
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014:
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Son_of_Batman_(film)" title="Son of Batman (film)">
         Son of Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       , a loose adaptation of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_and_Son" title="Batman and Son">
         Batman and Son
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Jason_O%27Mara" title="Jason O'Mara">
        Jason O'Mara
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Assault_on_Arkham" title="Batman: Assault on Arkham">
         Assault on Arkham
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Arkham" title="Batman: Arkham">
         Batman: Arkham
        </a>
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2015:
       <i>
        Batman vs. Robin
       </i>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="With_other_heroes">
       With other heroes
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: With other heroes">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       2008:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_The_New_Frontier" title="Justice League: The New Frontier">
         Justice League: The New Frontier
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on the
       <a href="/wiki/DC:_The_New_Frontier" title="DC: The New Frontier">
        comic of the same name
       </a>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Jeremy_Sisto" title="Jeremy Sisto">
        Jeremy Sisto
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2009:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Superman/Batman:_Public_Enemies" title="Superman/Batman: Public Enemies">
         Superman/Batman: Public Enemies
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on the comic of the same name with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2010:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_Crisis_on_Two_Earths" title="Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths">
         Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths
        </a>
       </i>
       , a loose adaptation of various DC comics with
       <a href="/wiki/William_Baldwin" title="William Baldwin">
        William Baldwin
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2010:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Superman/Batman:_Apocalypse" title="Superman/Batman: Apocalypse">
         Superman/Batman: Apocalypse
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        Superman/Batman: The Supergirl from Krypton
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2010:
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/DC_Super_Friends" title="DC Super Friends">
         DC Super Friends
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on the
       <a href="/wiki/Fisher-Price" title="Fisher-Price">
        Fisher-Price
       </a>
       toyline with
       <a href="/wiki/Daran_Norris" title="Daran Norris">
        Daran Norris
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2012:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_Doom" title="Justice League: Doom">
         Justice League: Doom
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/JLA:_Tower_of_Babel" title="JLA: Tower of Babel">
         JLA: Tower of Babel
        </a>
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2013:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_The_Flashpoint_Paradox" title="Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox">
         Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Flashpoint_(comics)" title="Flashpoint (comics)">
         Flashpoint
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Kevin_McKidd" title="Kevin McKidd">
        Kevin McKidd
       </a>
       and Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/JLA_Adventures:_Trapped_in_Time" title="JLA Adventures: Trapped in Time">
         JLA Adventures: Trapped in Time
        </a>
       </i>
       , an original story with
       <a href="/wiki/Diedrich_Bader" title="Diedrich Bader">
        Diedrich Bader
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_War" title="Justice League: War">
         Justice League: War
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        Justice League: Origin
       </i>
       with Jason O'Mara voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2015:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_Throne_of_Atlantis" title="Justice League: Throne of Atlantis">
         Justice League: Throne of Atlantis
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Throne_of_Atlantis" title="Throne of Atlantis">
         Throne of Atlantis
        </a>
       </i>
       with Jason O'Mara voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2015:
       <i>
        Justice League: Gods and Monsters
       </i>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Other">
       Other
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: Other">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       2008:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Gotham_Knight" title="Batman: Gotham Knight">
         Batman: Gotham Knight
        </a>
       </i>
       , a collection of original shorts with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014: A
       <a href="/wiki/Lego" title="Lego">
        Lego
       </a>
       -themed version of Batman appears in
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Lego_Movie" title="The Lego Movie">
         The Lego Movie
        </a>
       </i>
       , voiced by
       <a href="/wiki/Will_Arnett" title="Will Arnett">
        Will Arnett
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Newspaper">
       Newspaper
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: Newspaper">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_(comic_strip)" title="Batman (comic strip)">
       Batman (comic strip)
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      From 1943 to 1946, Batman and Robin appeared in a syndicated daily newspaper
      <a href="/wiki/Comic_strip" title="Comic strip">
       comic strip
      </a>
      produced by the McClure Syndicate. Other versions appeared in 1953, 1966, and 1989. The original run is collected in the book
      <i>
       Batman: The Dailies
      </i>
      . One more comic strip series ran briefly after the success of the 1989 film.
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Books">
       Books
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Books">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <p>
      Batman appears in a novel by cyberpunk/horror novelist
      <a href="/wiki/John_Shirley" title="John Shirley">
       John Shirley
      </a>
      , titled
      <i>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dead_White_(Batman_novel)" title="Dead White (Batman novel)">
        Batman: Dead White
       </a>
      </i>
      from
      <a href="/wiki/Del_Rey_Books" title="Del Rey Books">
       Del Rey
      </a>
      . Many other novels and short story collections featuring Batman have been published over the years, including novelizations of each of the recent movies (such as
      <i>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_(1989_novel)" title="Batman (1989 novel)">
        Batman
       </a>
      </i>
      and
      <i>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_Rises_(novel)" title="The Dark Knight Rises (novel)">
        The Dark Knight Rises
       </a>
      </i>
      ) and many of the comic book arcs.
     </p>
     <p>
      There are also several more scholarly works, aimed at either Batman's history or art, such as
      <a href="/wiki/Les_Daniels" title="Les Daniels">
       Les Daniels
      </a>
      '
      <i>
       Batman: The Complete History
      </i>
      or
      <a href="/wiki/Will_Brooker" title="Will Brooker">
       Will Brooker's
      </a>
      <i>
       Batman Unmasked: Analysing a Cultural Icon
      </i>
      . and compilations such as
      <i>
       Batman: Cover to Cover: The Greatest Comic Book Covers of the Dark Knight
      </i>
      . In 2004,
      <i>
       The Batman Handbook: The Ultimate Training Manual
      </i>
      , written by
      <a href="/wiki/Scott_Beatty" title="Scott Beatty">
       Scott Beatty
      </a>
      was published by Quirk Books (
      <a class="internal mw-magiclink-isbn" href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/1594740232">
       ISBN 1-59474-023-2
      </a>
      ). Written in the same style as
      <i>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Worst-Case_Scenario_Survival_Handbook" title="The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook">
        The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook
       </a>
      </i>
      series, the book explained the basics on how to be Batman. Amongst the skills included in the book are "How to Train a Sidekick", "How to Execute a Backflip", "How to Throw a Grappling Hook", and "How to Survive a Poison Gas Attack". Finally, there are of course countless sticker, coloring, activity, and other children's books featuring the Dark Knight.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-15">
       <a href="#cite_note-15">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        15
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Foreign_comics">
       Foreign comics
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: Foreign comics">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Child_of_Dreams" title="Batman: Child of Dreams">
         Batman: Child of Dreams
        </a>
       </i>
       by
       <a href="/wiki/Kia_Asamiya" title="Kia Asamiya">
        Kia Asamiya
       </a>
       
       <a href="/wiki/Manga" title="Manga">
        manga
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        Batman: Death Mask
       </i>
       by
       <a href="/wiki/Yoshinori_Natsume" title="Yoshinori Natsume">
        Yoshinori Natsume
       </a>
       
       <a href="/wiki/Manga" title="Manga">
        manga
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Bat-Manga!:_The_Secret_History_of_Batman_in_Japan" title="Bat-Manga!: The Secret History of Batman in Japan">
         Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       by
       <a href="/wiki/Jiro_Kuwata" title="Jiro Kuwata">
        Jiro Kuwata
       </a>
       
       <a href="/wiki/Manga" title="Manga">
        manga
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        Batman trong Ht Thn
       </i>
       by Nguyn ThVietnamese comics
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        Batman: God of Africa
       </i>
       
       <a href="/wiki/Manhua" title="Manhua">
        manhua
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Novelty_singles">
       Novelty singles
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: Novelty singles">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <p>
      Several musical singles featuring cast members of the television show singing in-character were released in 1966:
      <a href="/wiki/Burgess_Meredith" title="Burgess Meredith">
       Burgess Meredith
      </a>
      as the Penguin in "The Capture" and "The Escape",
      <a href="/wiki/Frank_Gorshin" title="Frank Gorshin">
       Frank Gorshin
      </a>
      as the Riddler in "The Riddler", and
      <a href="/wiki/Adam_West" title="Adam West">
       Adam West
      </a>
      as Batman in "Miranda". In 1976 West performed a pair of novelty songs, "The Story of Batman" and "Batman and Robin", for Target Records. All six of these recordings (sans the b-sides to Gorshin and West's singles) were later included on the 1997 compilation,
      <i>
       Batmania: Songs Inspired by Batman TV Series
      </i>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      In 1966,
      <a href="/wiki/Burt_Ward" title="Burt Ward">
       Burt Ward
      </a>
      also recorded a limited "disc jokey only" release with
      <a href="/wiki/Frank_Zappa" title="Frank Zappa">
       Frank Zappa
      </a>
      called "Boy Wonder, I Love You".
     </p>
     <p>
      Also in 1966, British novelty group
      <a href="/wiki/The_Scaffold" title="The Scaffold">
       The Scaffold
      </a>
      produced a single called "Goodbat Nightman" (lyrics by
      <a href="/wiki/Roger_McGough" title="Roger McGough">
       Roger McGough
      </a>
      , who "has written several poems" about Batman and Robin).
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-16">
       <a href="#cite_note-16">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        16
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Audio_drama">
       Audio drama
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16" title="Edit section: Audio drama">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <p>
      Following the popularity of the Adam West television series, a pair of LPs were released in 1966 on MGM's "Leo the Lion" label. Each contained three dramatizations, including stories adapted from Batman comic books:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       The Official Adventures Of Batman And Robin:
       <ul>
        <li>
         The Legend of Batman and Robin
        </li>
        <li>
         The Penguin's Plunder
        </li>
        <li>
         The Joker's Revenge
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       More Official Adventures of Batman &amp; Robin:
       <ul>
        <li>
         The Marriage of Batman and Batwoman
        </li>
        <li>
         The Fake Boy Wonder
        </li>
        <li>
         When Batman Became a Coward
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      Throughout the 1970s Batman was the subject of a number of
      <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pan_Records" title="Peter Pan Records">
       Power Records
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/Book-and-record_set" title="Book-and-record set">
       Book-and-record sets
      </a>
      , as well as records unaccompanied by books:
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-17">
       <a href="#cite_note-17">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        17
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      45 rpm book and record sets:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Batman: Stacked Cards
      </li>
      <li>
       Batman: Robin Meets Man-Bat
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      7" 33
      <span class="frac nowrap">
       <sup>
        1
       </sup>
       
       <sub>
        3
       </sub>
      </span>
      rpm records no comic:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Batman: If Music be the Food of Death
      </li>
      <li>
       Batman: The Scarecrow's Mirages
      </li>
      <li>
       Batman: Catwoman's Revenge
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      33
      <span class="frac nowrap">
       <sup>
        1
       </sup>
       
       <sub>
        3
       </sub>
      </span>
      rpm 12 book and record sets:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Batman: Gorilla City &amp; Mystery of the Scarecrow Corpse
      </li>
      <li>
       Batman (Collects Stacked Cards, The Scarecrow's Mirage, Challenge of the Catwoman, If Music Be the Food of Death)
      </li>
      <li>
       Batman (Collects Robin Meets Man Bat, Gorilla City, Mystery of the Scarecrow Corpse, The Catwoman's Revenge)
      </li>
      <li>
       A Super Hero Christmas (segment Batman: Christmas Carol Caper)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      The 1980 mini-series,
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Untold_Legend_of_the_Batman" title="The Untold Legend of the Batman">
        The Untold Legend of the Batman
       </a>
      </i>
      was available in a special "MPI Audio Edition." Each of the three issues were accompanied by an audio cassette containing a performance of the text of the issue, with musical cues.
     </p>
     <p>
      As part of its DC Superheroes collection, in 1982
      <a href="/wiki/Fisher-Price" title="Fisher-Price">
       Fisher-Price
      </a>
      released
      <i>
       Batman: The Case of the Laughing Sphinx
      </i>
      , an audio cassette accompanied by a hard back illustrated book.
     </p>
     <p>
      In 2007, the audiobook publisher
      <a href="/wiki/GraphicAudio" title="GraphicAudio">
       GraphicAudio
      </a>
      licensed DC Comics properties to adapt as audiodramas. They have produced three adaptations of Batman novels:
      <i>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dead_White_(Batman_novel)" title="Dead White (Batman novel)">
        Batman: Dead White
       </a>
      </i>
      by
      <a href="/wiki/John_Shirley" title="John Shirley">
       John Shirley
      </a>
      ,
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Inferno_(Batman_novel)" title="Inferno (Batman novel)">
        Batman: Inferno
       </a>
      </i>
      by
      <a href="/wiki/Alexander_C._Irvine" title="Alexander C. Irvine">
       Alex Irvine
      </a>
      , and
      <a href="/wiki/Alan_Grant_(writer)" title="Alan Grant (writer)">
       Alan Grant's
      </a>
      <i>
       Batman: The Stone King
      </i>
      . Batman also appears as a supporting cast member in the GraphicAudio's adaptations of
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Crisis_on_Infinite_Earths" title="Crisis on Infinite Earths">
        Crisis on Infinite Earths
       </a>
      </i>
      ,
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Infinite_Crisis" title="Infinite Crisis">
        Infinite Crisis
       </a>
      </i>
      and
      <i>
       JLA: Exterminators
      </i>
      .
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Video_games">
       Video games
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17" title="Edit section: Video games">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_Batman_video_games" title="List of Batman video games">
       List of Batman video games
      </a>
     </div>
     <div class="thumb tright">
      <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
       <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Batman_Begins_game.jpg">
        <img alt="Batman is shown at the left side of the screen, ready to fight. The target is a prone figure on the other side of the screen." class="thumbimage" data-file-height="235" data-file-width="300" height="172" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c4/Batman_Begins_game.jpg/220px-Batman_Begins_game.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/c/c4/Batman_Begins_game.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/c/c4/Batman_Begins_game.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
       </a>
       <div class="thumbcaption">
        <div class="magnify">
         <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Batman_Begins_game.jpg" title="Enlarge">
         </a>
        </div>
        Screenshot from the
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Batman_Begins_(video_game)" title="Batman Begins (video game)">
          Batman Begins
         </a>
        </i>
        video game
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <p>
      Several Batman video games were created:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1986_video_game)" title="Batman (1986 video game)">
         Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       (1986) for the
       <a href="/wiki/ZX_Spectrum" title="ZX Spectrum">
        ZX Spectrum
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/MSX" title="MSX">
        MSX
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Amstrad_PCW" title="Amstrad PCW">
        Amstrad PCW
       </a>
       ; now known as
       <i>
        Batman 3D
       </i>
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Caped_Crusader" title="Batman: The Caped Crusader">
         Batman: The Caped Crusader
        </a>
       </i>
       (1988) for various
       <a href="/wiki/8-bit" title="8-bit">
        8-bit
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/16-bit" title="16-bit">
        16-bit
       </a>
       platforms
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_(video_game)" title="Batman (video game)">
         Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       (1989) for
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mega_Drive" title="Mega Drive">
        Mega Drive/Sega Genesis
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Nintendo_Entertainment_System" title="Nintendo Entertainment System">
        Nintendo Entertainment System (NES)
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Atari_Lynx" title="Atari Lynx">
        Atari Lynx
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Commodore_Amiga" title="Commodore Amiga">
        Commodore Amiga
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/ZX_Spectrum" title="ZX Spectrum">
        Sinclair ZX Spectrum
       </a>
       and other platforms. (In October 1989, the
       <a href="/wiki/Amiga_500" title="Amiga 500">
        Amiga 500
       </a>
       was bundled with this game as part of the
       <i>
        Batman Pack
       </i>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-18">
        <a href="#cite_note-18">
         <span>
          [
         </span>
         18
         <span>
          ]
         </span>
        </a>
       </sup>
       which was sold in the United Kingdom and was a phenomenal success)
      </li>

       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Return_of_the_Joker" title="Batman: Return of the Joker">
         Batman: Return of the Joker
        </a>
       </i>
       (1991) for Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) and

       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Game.com" title="Game.com">

       </a>

       (2000) for the

       </a>
       and the PlayStation

       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Chaos_in_Gotham" title="Batman: Chaos in Gotham">
         Batman: Chaos in Gotham
        </a>
       </i>
       (2001) for
       <a href="/wiki/Game_Boy_Color" title="Game Boy Color">
        Game Boy Color
       </a>

        </a>
       </i>
       (2001) A racing game for the PlayStation
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Vengeance" title="Batman: Vengeance">

        </a>
       </i>
       (2001) for the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Nintendo_GameCube" title="Nintendo GameCube">

       </a>
       ,

        Game Boy Advance
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Xbox_(console)" title="Xbox (console)">
        Xbox
       </a>
      </li>

        </a>
       </i>
       (2003) for Xbox and Nintendo GameCube
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Rise_of_Sin_Tzu" title="Batman: Rise of Sin Tzu">
         Batman: Rise of Sin Tzu
        </a>
       </i>
       (2004) for the PlayStation 2, Xbox, the Nintendo GameCube and Game Boy Advance
      </li>
     </ul>

       <i>

         Gotham City Impostors

       <a href="/wiki/PlayStation_Network" title="PlayStation Network">
        PlayStation Network
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Xbox_Live_Arcade" title="Xbox Live Arcade">
        Xbox Live Arcade
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Games_for_Windows_Live" title="Games for Windows Live">

       ; a "team deathmatch" game, with one team dressed like Batman and the other dressed like The Joker
      </li>

       <i>

         Injustice: Gods Among Us

       <a href="/wiki/Xbox_One" title="Xbox One">

        Wii U
       </a>

        Kevin Conroy
       </a>
       .
      </li>

       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Arkham_Origins" title="Batman: Arkham Origins">
         Batman: Arkham Origins
        </a>
       </i>
