       <i>
        Arkham Asylum
       </i>
       and
       <i>
        Arkham City
       </i>
       .
       <a href="/wiki/Roger_Craig_Smith" title="Roger Craig Smith">
        Roger Craig Smith
       </a>
       voices Batman.
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Arkham_Origins_Blackgate" title="Batman: Arkham Origins Blackgate">
         Batman: Arkham Origins Blackgate
        </a>
       </i>
       (2013) for
       <a href="/wiki/Nintendo_3DS" title="Nintendo 3DS">
        Nintendo 3DS
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/PlayStation_Vita" title="PlayStation Vita">
        PlayStation Vita
       </a>
       : 2.5D platform game set between
       <i>
        Arkham Origins
       </i>
       and
       <i>
        Arkham Asylum
       </i>
       .
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Lego_Batman_3:_Beyond_Gotham" title="Lego Batman 3: Beyond Gotham">
         Lego Batman 3: Beyond Gotham
        </a>
       </i>
       (2014) The sequel to
       <i>
        Lego Batman 2: DC Superheroes
       </i>
       . Troy Baker reprises as Lego Batman.
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Arkham_Knight" title="Batman: Arkham Knight">
         Batman: Arkham Knight
        </a>
       </i>
       (2015) The sequel to
       <i>
        Arkham City
       </i>
       and the final game in the
       <i>
        Arkham
       </i>
       series, to be released for
       <a href="/wiki/Xbox_One" title="Xbox One">
        Xbox One
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/PlayStation_4" title="PlayStation 4">
        PlayStation 4
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Microsoft_Windows" title="Microsoft Windows">
        Microsoft Windows
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-20">
        <a href="#cite_note-20">
         <span>
          [
         </span>
         20
         <span>
          ]
         </span>
        </a>
       </sup>
       <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Conroy" title="Kevin Conroy">
        Kevin Conroy
       </a>
       is voicing Batman again.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-21">
        <a href="#cite_note-21">
         <span>
          [
         </span>
         21
         <span>
          ]
         </span>
        </a>
       </sup>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      Batman appears in the
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Justice_League_Task_Force_(video_game)" title="Justice League Task Force (video game)">
        Justice League Task Force
       </a>
      </i>
      <a href="/wiki/Super_Nintendo_Entertainment_System" title="Super Nintendo Entertainment System">
       Super Nintendo
      </a>
      fighting game, a pair of
      <i>
       Justice League
      </i>
      games for Game Boy Advance, and an arcade game based on
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1989_film)" title="Batman (1989 film)">
       the Tim Burton film
      </a>
      . He appears in the
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Justice_League_Heroes" title="Justice League Heroes">
        Justice League Heroes
       </a>
      </i>
      game for PS2, Xbox, and PSP and has appeared in the crossover game
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Mortal_Kombat_vs._DC_Universe" title="Mortal Kombat vs. DC Universe">
        Mortal Kombat vs. DC Universe
       </a>
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22">
       <a href="#cite_note-22">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        22
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Batman has also appeared as a non-player character in the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/MMORPG" title="MMORPG">
       MMORPG
      </a>
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/DC_Universe_Online" title="DC Universe Online">
        DC Universe Online
       </a>
      </i>
      . He is one of the three available "mentors" for the player, choosing him as a mentor will open an exclusive storyline and exclusive missions. Batman can be unlocked to use in Legends PVP matches with two available appearances: the normal Batman or Future Batman, wearing a grey plated armor instead of a suit, and a helmet instead of just a cowl.
     </p>
     <p>
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Revenge_of_Shinobi" title="The Revenge of Shinobi">
        The Revenge of Shinobi
       </a>
      </i>
      features a non-authorized Batman as a
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Boss_(video_games)" title="Boss (video games)">
       boss
      </a>
      . The 8-bit Nintendo Entertainment System game
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Final_Fantasy" title="Final Fantasy">
        Final Fantasy
       </a>
      </i>
      features "Badman", a character with strong resemblances to Batman, as one of the enemies of the final area.
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Musical_theatre">
       Musical theatre
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18" title="Edit section: Musical theatre">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <p>
      While a parody of a
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      <a href="/wiki/Musical_theatre" title="Musical theatre">
       musical
      </a>
      was featured in one of the most recent series' comics, in 2002,
      <a href="/wiki/Jim_Steinman" title="Jim Steinman">
       Jim Steinman
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/David_Ives" title="David Ives">
       David Ives
      </a>
      , and
      <a href="/wiki/Tim_Burton" title="Tim Burton">
       Tim Burton
      </a>
      had worked on a theatre production called
      <i>
       Batman: The Musical
      </i>
      although it was ultimately cancelled. Steinman has revealed five songs from the musical. The first is the opening theme for "Gotham City" and the entry of Batman with his tortured solo "The Graveyard Shift"; followed by "The Joker's Song (Where Does He Get All Those Wonderful Toys?)", "The Catwoman's Song (I Need All The Love I Can Get)", "We're Still The Children We Once Were" (the climactic sequence) and "In The Land Of The Pig The Butcher Is King", sung by the corrupt blood-suckers ruling Gotham, covered on the
      <a href="/wiki/Meat_Loaf" title="Meat Loaf">
       Meat Loaf
      </a>
      album
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Bat_Out_of_Hell_III:_The_Monster_Is_Loose" title="Bat Out of Hell III: The Monster Is Loose">
        Bat Out of Hell III: The Monster Is Loose
       </a>
      </i>
      . These songs can be heard at the
      <i>
       Batman: The Musical
      </i>
      memorial site,
      <a class="external text" href="http://www.freewebs.com/batman_themusical" rel="nofollow">
       Dark Knight of the Soul
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      A Batman musical is also parodied in the animated series
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Beyond" title="Batman Beyond">
        Batman Beyond
       </a>
      </i>
      . The episode "Out of the Past", (first aired October 21, 2000) opens with Bruce Wayne and
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_(Terry_McGinnis)" title="Batman (Terry McGinnis)">
       Terry McGinnis
      </a>
      attending a performance of (a fictional)
      <i>
       Batman: The Musical
      </i>
      , featuring caricatures of prominent members of the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Enemies_of_Batman" title="Enemies of Batman">
       Rogues Gallery
      </a>
      (the Joker, the Penguin, Two-Face, Catwoman, Poison Ivy, and Harley Quinn). Series creator
      <a href="/wiki/Paul_Dini" title="Paul Dini">
       Paul Dini
      </a>
      , who wrote the episode in question, also wrote a song for the fictitious musical entitled
      <i>
       Superstitious and Cowardly Lot
      </i>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      An episode of the sketch comedy show
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/MADtv" title="MADtv">
        MADtv
       </a>
      </i>
      also featured a
      <i>
       Batman: The Musical
      </i>
      parody called
      <i>
       Batman V: Out of the Cave
      </i>
      which starred
      <a href="/wiki/Tommy_Tune" title="Tommy Tune">
       Tommy Tune
      </a>
      as Batman, and
      <a href="/wiki/Ben_Vereen" title="Ben Vereen">
       Ben Vereen
      </a>
      as Robin.
     </p>
     <p>
      A live stage show was also created, called
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Live" title="Batman Live">
        Batman Live: World Tour
       </a>
      </i>
      . The show is a unique fusion of live action theatre, magic, stunts, digital projection and music from an 85 piece orchestra and choir. The tour began at Manchester, UK in Summer 2011 and is set to tour arenas throughout the UK and Europe before arriving in North America by Summer 2012.
     </p>
     <p>
      In 2012, the Internet theatre troupe
      <a href="/wiki/StarKid_Productions" title="StarKid Productions">
       StarKid Productions
      </a>
      created a musical titled
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Holy_Musical_B@man!" title="Holy Musical B@man!">
        Holy Musical B@man!
       </a>
      </i>
      , which went on YouTube on April 13. It was performed in Chicago from March 1625, and because of copyright laws, tickets were free.
      <a href="/wiki/Batman" title="Batman">
       Batman
      </a>
      is portrayed by Joseph (Joe) Walker.
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Games.2C_action_figures.2C_and_other_toys">
       Games, action figures, and other toys
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: Games, action figures, and other toys">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_action_figures" title="Batman action figures">
       Batman action figures
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      Hundreds of
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_action_figures" title="Batman action figures">
       Batman action figures
      </a>
      ,
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Die-cast_model" title="Die-cast model">
       die-cast models
      </a>
      , and other items have been released. Many companies have acquired the rights to make Batman merchandise, including:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Ideal_Toy_Company" title="Ideal Toy Company">
        Ideal
       </a>
       
       <a href="/wiki/Captain_Action" title="Captain Action">
        Captain Action
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Mego_Corporation" title="Mego Corporation">
        Mego
       </a>
       Action figures and
       <a href="/wiki/Doll" title="Doll">
        dolls
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Corgi_Cars" title="Corgi Cars">
        Corgi
       </a>
       Die-cast metal
       <a href="/wiki/Vehicle" title="Vehicle">
        vehicles
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Remco" title="Remco">
        Remco
       </a>
       
       <a href="/wiki/Playset" title="Playset">
        Playsets
       </a>
       and roleplaying toys
      </li>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Toy_Biz" title="Toy Biz">
        Toy Biz
       </a>
       Action figures
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Ertl_Company" title="Ertl Company">
        Ertl
       </a>
       Die-cast figures &amp; vehicles and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Model_kit" title="Model kit">
        model kits
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       Applause
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PVC" title="PVC">
        PVC
       </a>
       figures and
       <a href="/wiki/Doll" title="Doll">
        dolls
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Hasbro" title="Hasbro">
        Hasbro
       </a>
       Action figures
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Monogram_models" title="Monogram models">
        Monogram
       </a>
       
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bobble_head" title="Bobble head">
        Bobble heads
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Mattel" title="Mattel">
        Mattel
       </a>
       Action figures and
       <a href="/wiki/Jigsaw_puzzle" title="Jigsaw puzzle">
        jigsaw puzzles
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Lego" title="Lego">
        Lego
       </a>
       Building bricks and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Minifigure" title="Minifigure">
        minifigures
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      Batman has appeared as a
      <a href="/wiki/HeroClix" title="HeroClix">
       HeroClix
      </a>
      figure along with other Batman characters in the following HeroClix sets:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hypertime_(heroclix)" title="Hypertime (heroclix)">
        Hypertime
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       Cosmic Justice
      </li>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Unleashed_(heroclix)" title="Unleashed (heroclix)">
        Unleashed
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Legacy_(heroclix)" title="Legacy (heroclix)">
        Legacy
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Icons_(heroclix)" title="Icons (heroclix)">
        Icons
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      For April 2006, Lego introduced a Batman line which also includes characters such as
      <a href="/wiki/Joker_(comics)" title="Joker (comics)">
       the Joker
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Two-Face" title="Two-Face">
       Two-Face
      </a>
      , at
      <a href="/wiki/American_International_Toy_Fair" title="American International Toy Fair">
       American International Toy Fair
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Theme_park_attractions">
       Theme park attractions
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_franchise_media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20" title="Edit section: Theme park attractions">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_amusement_rides_and_stunt_shows" title="Batman amusement rides and stunt shows">
       Batman amusement rides and stunt shows
      </a>
     </div>
     <div class="thumb tright">
      <div class="thumbinner" style="width:171px;">
       <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Batwing_Spaceshot.JPG">
        <img alt="the central, metal laticework spire of the Batwing Spaceshot ride." class="thumbimage" data-file-height="225" data-file-width="169" height="225" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/d/d4/Batwing_Spaceshot.JPG" width="169"/>
       </a>
       <div class="thumbcaption">
        <div class="magnify">
         <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Batwing_Spaceshot.JPG" title="Enlarge">
         </a>
        </div>
        The
        <a href="/wiki/Batwing_Spaceshot" title="Batwing Spaceshot">
         Batwing Spaceshot
        </a>
        tower is 61 metres (200ft) tall.
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <p>
      Several
      <a href="/wiki/Six_Flags" title="Six Flags">
       Six Flags
      </a>
      theme parks, formerly owned by
      <a href="/wiki/Warner_Bros." title="Warner Bros.">
       Warner Bros.
      </a>
      , opened live-action "Batman Stunt Shows" as the movies increased in popularity. The now closed
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Six_Flags_Astroworld" title="Six Flags Astroworld">
       Six Flags Astroworld
      </a>
      in
      <a href="/wiki/Houston" title="Houston">
       Houston
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Texas" title="Texas">
       Texas
      </a>
      was home to a standing roller coaster known as Batman: The Escape.
      <a href="/wiki/Six_Flags_Over_Texas" title="Six Flags Over Texas">
       Six Flags Over Texas
      </a>
      in
      <a href="/wiki/Arlington,_Texas" title="Arlington, Texas">
       Arlington, Texas
      </a>
      is home to two roller coasters called
      <a href="/wiki/Mr._Freeze_(roller_coaster)" title="Mr. Freeze (roller coaster)">
       Mr. Freeze
      </a>
      , and
      <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Ride" title="Batman: The Ride">
       Batman: The Ride
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Six_Flags_M%C3%A9xico" title="Six Flags Mxico">
       Six Flags Mxico
      </a>
      in
      <a href="/wiki/Mexico_City" title="Mexico City">
       Mexico City
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">
       Mexico
      </a>
      has also a looping, suspended
      <a href="/wiki/Roller_coaster" title="Roller coaster">
       roller coaster
      </a>
      named Batman: The Ride (
      <a href="/wiki/Six_Flags_St._Louis" title="Six Flags St. Louis">
       Six Flags St. Louis
      </a>
      has the same ride, as does
      <a href="/wiki/Six_Flags_Great_America" title="Six Flags Great America">
       Six Flags Great America
      </a>
      in
      <a href="/wiki/Gurnee,_Illinois" title="Gurnee, Illinois">
       Gurnee, Illinois
      </a>
      ) as well as twin
      <a href="/wiki/Roller_coaster" title="Roller coaster">
       roller coasters
      </a>
      named Batman and Robin: The Chiller. On the latter attraction, riders may ride on either the Batman or Robin versions of the coaster. But unfortunately in the 2007 off-season, the ride was removed after a long history of technical difficulties and occasionally breaking down.
      <a href="/wiki/Six_Flags_Over_Georgia" title="Six Flags Over Georgia">
       Six Flags Over Georgia
      </a>
      contains a Gotham City area that contains the same Batman: The Ride and also features a looping coaster called The Mindbender that was adapted to fit the color tone of the
      <a href="/wiki/Riddler" title="Riddler">
       Riddler
      </a>
      after
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Forever" title="Batman Forever">
        Batman Forever
       </a>
      </i>
      came out to fit the
      <a href="/wiki/Gotham_City" title="Gotham City">
       Gotham City
      </a>
      section of the park it shares with Batman: The Ride.
      <a href="/wiki/Six_Flags_Magic_Mountain" title="Six Flags Magic Mountain">
       Six Flags Magic Mountain
      </a>
      in
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Valencia,_Santa_Clarita,_California" title="Valencia, Santa Clarita, California">
       Valencia, California
      </a>
      has two Batman-themed coasters, the suspended coaster Batman: The Ride, and The Riddler's Revenge, a stand-up type roller coaster. This Six Flags park also features an entire themed area called "Gotham City" complete with architecture to match that of the fictional Gotham City.
      <a href="/wiki/Warner_Bros._Movie_World" title="Warner Bros. Movie World">
       Warner Bros. Movie World
      </a>
      in the
      <a href="/wiki/Gold_Coast,_Queensland" title="Gold Coast, Queensland">
       Gold Coast
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia">
       Australia
      </a>
      , also has two Batman-themed rides.
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_Adventure_%E2%80%93_The_Ride_2" title="Batman Adventure  The Ride 2">
       Batman Adventure  The Ride
      </a>
      , revamped in 2001, is a
      <a href="/wiki/Motion_simulator" title="Motion simulator">
       motion simulator
      </a>
      style simulator ride while
      <a href="/wiki/Batwing_Spaceshot" title="Batwing Spaceshot">
       Batwing Spaceshot
      </a>
      is a vertical free-fall ride.
     </p>
     <p>
      In 2008, The Dark Knight Coaster opened in
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_(Six_Flags_Great_Adventure)" title="The Dark Knight (Six Flags Great Adventure)">
       Six Flags Great Adventure
      </a>
      and
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_(Six_Flags_Great_America)" title="The Dark Knight (Six Flags Great America)">
       Six Flags Great America
      </a>
      . Based on
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_(film)" title="The Dark Knight (film)">
        The Dark Knight
       </a>
      </i>
      film, they are
      <a href="/wiki/Wild_Mouse_roller_coaster" title="Wild Mouse roller coaster">
       Wild Mouse roller coasters
      </a>
      , indoors, heavily themed, and give riders a feeling that they are being stalked by the Joker.
      <a href="/wiki/Six_Flags_New_England" title="Six Flags New England">
       Six Flags New England
      </a>
      was originally going to receive this roller coaster; however, due to problems with building permits, the park scratched the project and then sent the coaster to
      <a href="/wiki/Six_Flags_M%C3%A9xico" title="Six Flags Mxico">
       Six Flags Mxico
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">
       See also
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">

        </span>

          <span class="reference-accessdate">
           . Retrieved January 14, 2014
          </span>

         </span>
         <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABatman+franchise+media&amp;rft.btitle=TVGuide%3A+%23Gotham+will+also+include+origin&amp;rft.date=January+13%2C+2014&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2FTVGuide%2Fstatus%2F422814132379734017&amp;rft.pub=Twitter&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook">

       <li id="cite_note-collider-8">
        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         ^
         <a href="#cite_ref-collider_8-0">
          <sup>
           <i>
            <b>
             a
            </b>
           </i>
          </sup>
         </a>

           <a href="/wiki/Batman_in_film" title="Batman in film">

            <br/>
            serials and films

   <h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" lang="en">
    <span dir="auto">
     Batman (disambiguation)
    </span>
   </h1>
   <div class="mw-body-content" id="bodyContent">
    <div id="siteSub">
     From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
    </div>
    <div id="contentSub">
    </div>
    <div class="mw-jump" id="jump-to-nav">
     Jump to:
     <a href="#mw-navigation">
      navigation
     </a>
     ,
     <a href="#p-search">
      search
     </a>
    </div>
    <div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en">
     <table class="mbox-small plainlinks" style="border:1px solid #aaa;background-color:#f9f9f9">
      <tr>
       <td class="mbox-image">
        <img alt="" data-file-height="1089" data-file-width="1000" height="40" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f8/Wiktionary-logo-en.svg/37px-Wiktionary-logo-en.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f8/Wiktionary-logo-en.svg/55px-Wiktionary-logo-en.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f8/Wiktionary-logo-en.svg/73px-Wiktionary-logo-en.svg.png 2x" width="37"/>
       </td>
       <td class="mbox-text plainlist">
        Look up
        <i>
         <b>
          <a class="extiw" href="//en.wiktionary.org/wiki/batman" title="wiktionary:batman">
           batman
          </a>
         </b>
        </i>
        or
        <i>
         <b>
          <a class="extiw" href="//en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Batman" title="wiktionary:Batman">
           Batman
          </a>
         </b>
        </i>
        in Wiktionary, the free dictionary.
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
     <p>
      <b>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman" title="Batman">
        Batman
       </a>
      </b>
      is a National/DC comic book superhero.
     </p>
     <p>
      <b>
       Batman
      </b>
      may also refer to:
     </p>
     <div style="clear: right; margin-bottom: .5em; float: right; padding: .5em 0 .8em 1.4em; background: none; width: auto;">

     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Print_media">
       Print media
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Print media">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(comic_book)" title="Batman (comic book)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (comic book)
       </a>
       , published from 1940 to the present
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(comic_strip)" title="Batman (comic strip)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (comic strip)
       </a>
       , in newspapers from 1943 to 1991
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(Earth-Two)" title="Batman (Earth-Two)">
        Batman (Earth-Two)
       </a>
       , an alternate version of the character
      </li>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_(set_index)" title="Batman (set index)">
        Batman (set index)
       </a>
       , the Batman alias used by a number of characters over the years
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Films_and_TV">
       Films and TV
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Films and TV">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_in_film" title="Batman in film">
       Batman in film
      </a>
     </div>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1966_film)" title="Batman (1966 film)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (1966 film)
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1989_film)" title="Batman (1989 film)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (1989 film)
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(serial)" title="Batman (serial)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (serial)
       </a>
       , a 1943 movie serial
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(Terry_McGinnis)" title="Batman (Terry McGinnis)">
        Batman (Terry McGinnis)
       </a>
       , the main character in
       <i>
        Batman Beyond
       </i>
       media
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(TV_series)" title="Batman (TV series)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (TV series)
       </a>
       , a 1960s television series
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Animated_Series" title="Batman: The Animated Series">
         Batman: The Animated Series
        </a>
       </i>
       , a 1990s animated series
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Mask_of_the_Phantasm" title="Batman: Mask of the Phantasm">
         Batman: Mask of the Phantasm
        </a>
       </i>
       , a 1993 animated film based on the 1990s animated series
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Brave_and_the_Bold" title="Batman: The Brave and the Bold">
         Batman: The Brave and the Bold
        </a>
       </i>
       , an animated series that debuted in 2008
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Batman_(TV_series)" title="The Batman (TV series)">
        <i>
         The Batman
        </i>
        (TV series)
       </a>
       , a 2000s animated series
      </li>
      <li>
       "Batman", nickname of Csar Gemes, a fictional drug dealer and henchmen in the telenovela
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/La_Reina_del_Sur_(telenovela)" title="La Reina del Sur (telenovela)">
         La Reina del Sur
        </a>
       </i>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Games">
       Games
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Games">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1986_video_game)" title="Batman (1986 video game)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (1986 video game)
       </a>
       , released in 1986 for the Amstrad CPC, ZX Spectrum, and MSX consoles
      </li>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_(Nintendo_Entertainment_System)" title="Batman (Nintendo Entertainment System)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (Nintendo Entertainment System)
       </a>
       , released in 1989 for the Nintendo Entertainment System
      </li>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_(Sega_Mega_Drive)" title="Batman (Sega Mega Drive)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (Sega Mega Drive)
       </a>
       , released in 1990 for the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(arcade_game)" title="Batman (arcade game)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (arcade game)
       </a>
       , released in 1990 by Atari for the arcade
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Arkham_Asylum" title="Batman: Arkham Asylum">
         Batman: Arkham Asylum
        </a>
       </i>
       , a 2009 video game developed by Rocksteady Studios
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Arkham_City" title="Batman: Arkham City">
         Batman: Arkham City
        </a>
       </i>
       , a 2011 video game developed by Rocksteady Studios
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Arkham_Origins" title="Batman: Arkham Origins">
         Batman: Arkham Origins
        </a>
       </i>
       , a 2013 video game developed by Warner Bros Games Studios
      </li>
      <li>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Arkham_Knight" title="Batman: Arkham Knight">
         Batman: Arkham Knight
        </a>
       </i>
       , a 2015 video game being developed by Rocksteady Studios
      </li>
     </ul>
     <div class="hatnote">
      Further information:
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_computer_and_video_games" title="Batman computer and video games">
       Batman computer and video games
      </a>

     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Music">
       Music
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Music">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(album)" title="Batman (album)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (album)
       </a>
       , an album by Prince
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(score)" title="Batman (score)">
        <i>
         Batman
        </i>
        (score)
       </a>
       , the film score album for the 1989 film
      </li>
      <li>
       "
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Theme" title="Batman Theme">
        Batman Theme
       </a>
       ", by Neal Hefti for the 1960s television show and recorded by many artists since
       <ul>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/Batman!_(Jan_and_Dean_song)" title="Batman! (Jan and Dean song)">
          "Batman!" (Jan and Dean song)
         </a>
         , based on the theme by Neal Hefti
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       "Batman", a song by John Zorn from
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Naked_City_(album)" title="Naked City (album)">
         Naked City
        </a>
       </i>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Places">
       Places
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Places">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Australia">
       Australia
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Australia">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Division_of_Batman" title="Division of Batman">
        Division of Batman
       </a>
       , an electoral district in Victoria named after John Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Bridge" title="Batman Bridge">
        Batman Bridge
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Highway" title="Batman Highway">
        Batman Highway
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_railway_station,_Melbourne" title="Batman railway station, Melbourne">
        Batman railway station, Melbourne
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman%27s_Hill" title="Batman's Hill">
        Batman's Hill
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Iran">
       Iran
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Iran">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman,_Iran" title="Batman, Iran">
        Batman, Iran
       </a>
       , a village in Kermanshah Province, Iran
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Turkey">
       Turkey
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: Turkey">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Province" title="Batman Province">
        Batman Province
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman,_Turkey" title="Batman, Turkey">
        Batman, Turkey
       </a>
       , the provincial capital of Batman Province
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_River" title="Batman River">
        Batman River
       </a>
       , a tributary of the Dicle River
      </li>
      <li>
       Batman, a small village in
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tunceli_Province" title="Tunceli Province">
        Tunceli Province
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="People">
       People
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: People">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(surname)" title="Batman (surname)">
        Batman (surname)
       </a>
       , a surname (and list of people with the name)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <dl>
      <dt>
       As nickname or stage name
      </dt>
     </dl>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman_Samini" title="Batman Samini">
        Batman Samini
       </a>
       (born 1981), Ghanaian musician
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Bershawn_Jackson" title="Bershawn Jackson">
        Bershawn Jackson
       </a>
       (born 1983), American athlete also known as Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Marques_Houston" title="Marques Houston">
        Marques Houston
       </a>
       (born 1981), American entertainer also known as Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Antonis_Fotsis" title="Antonis Fotsis">
        Antonis Fotsis
       </a>
       (born 1981), Greek basketball player
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Other_uses">
       Other uses
      </span>
      <span class="mw-editsection">
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        [
       </span>
       <a href="/w/index.php?title=Batman_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: Other uses">
        edit
       </a>
       <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
        ]
       </span>
      </span>
     </h2>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(military)" title="Batman (military)">
        Batman (military)
       </a>
       , a soldier assigned as a personal assistant to a commissioned officer
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(truck)" title="Batman (truck)">
        Batman (truck)
       </a>
       , a monster truck that debuted in 2006
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(unit)" title="Batman (unit)">
        Batman (unit)
       </a>
       , a historical unit of measure
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(2003_toy_line)" title="Batman (2003 toy line)">
        Batman (2003 toy line)
       </a>
       , six-inch model figures
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/B.A.T.M.A.N." title="B.A.T.M.A.N.">
        B.A.T.M.A.N.
       </a>
       , a mesh network routing protocol
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="/wiki/Bayesian_tool_for_methylation_analysis" title="Bayesian tool for methylation analysis">
        Bayesian tool for methylation analysis
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>

   <h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" lang="en">
    <span dir="auto">
     Batman in film
    </span>
   </h1>
   <div class="mw-body-content" id="bodyContent">
    <div id="siteSub">
     From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
    </div>
    <div id="contentSub">
    </div>
    <div class="mw-jump" id="jump-to-nav">
     Jump to:
     <a href="#mw-navigation">
      navigation
     </a>
     ,
     <a href="#p-search">
      search
     </a>
    </div>
    <div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en">
     <div class="metadata topicon nopopups" id="protected-icon" style="display:none;right:55px">
      <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Protection_policy#semi" title="This article is semi-protected.">
       <img alt="Page semi-protected" data-file-height="128" data-file-width="128" height="20" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Padlock-silver.svg/20px-Padlock-silver.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Padlock-silver.svg/30px-Padlock-silver.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Padlock-silver.svg/40px-Padlock-silver.svg.png 2x" width="20"/>
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      The fictional character
      <a href="/wiki/Batman" title="Batman">
       Batman
      </a>
      , a comic book superhero featured in
      <a href="/wiki/DC_Comics" title="DC Comics">
       DC Comics
      </a>
      publications, has appeared in various films since his inception. The character first starred in two serial films in the 1940s,
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(serial)" title="Batman (serial)">
        Batman
       </a>
      </i>
      and
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_and_Robin_(serial)" title="Batman and Robin (serial)">
        Batman and Robin
       </a>
      </i>
      . The character also appeared in the 1966 film
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1966_film)" title="Batman (1966 film)">
        Batman
       </a>
      </i>
      , which was a feature film adaptation of the 1960s
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(TV_series)" title="Batman (TV series)">
        Batman
       </a>
      </i>
      TV series starring
      <a href="/wiki/Adam_West" title="Adam West">
       Adam West
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Burt_Ward" title="Burt Ward">
       Burt Ward
      </a>
      , who also starred in the film.
     </p>
     <p>
      Toward the end of the 1980s, the
      <a href="/wiki/Warner_Bros." title="Warner Bros.">
       Warner Bros.
      </a>
      studio began producing a series of feature films starring Batman, beginning with the 1989 film
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1989_film)" title="Batman (1989 film)">
        Batman
       </a>
      </i>
      , directed by
      <a href="/wiki/Tim_Burton" title="Tim Burton">
       Tim Burton
      </a>
      and starring
      <a href="/wiki/Michael_Keaton" title="Michael Keaton">
       Michael Keaton
      </a>
      . Burton and Keaton returned for the 1992 sequel
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Returns" title="Batman Returns">
        Batman Returns
       </a>
      </i>
      , and in 1995,
      <a href="/wiki/Joel_Schumacher" title="Joel Schumacher">
       Joel Schumacher
      </a>
      directed
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Forever" title="Batman Forever">
        Batman Forever
       </a>
      </i>
      with
      <a href="/wiki/Val_Kilmer" title="Val Kilmer">
       Val Kilmer
      </a>
      as Batman. Schumacher also directed the 1997 sequel
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_%26_Robin_(film)" title="Batman &amp; Robin (film)">
        Batman &amp; Robin
       </a>
      </i>
      , which starred
      <a href="/wiki/George_Clooney" title="George Clooney">
       George Clooney
      </a>
      .
      <i>
       Batman &amp; Robin
      </i>
      was poorly received by both the critics and the fans, and after a long hiatus in which multiple possible Batman scripts were developed, Warner Bros.
      <a href="/wiki/Reboot_(fiction)" title="Reboot (fiction)">
       rebooted
      </a>
      the film franchise in 2005 with
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Begins" title="Batman Begins">
        Batman Begins
       </a>
      </i>
      , directed by
      <a href="/wiki/Christopher_Nolan" title="Christopher Nolan">
       Christopher Nolan
      </a>
      and starring
      <a href="/wiki/Christian_Bale" title="Christian Bale">
       Christian Bale
      </a>
      . Nolan returned to direct two further installments in the franchise,
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_(film)" title="The Dark Knight (film)">
        The Dark Knight
       </a>
      </i>
      in 2008 and
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_Rises" title="The Dark Knight Rises">
        The Dark Knight Rises
       </a>
      </i>
      in 2012 with Bale reprising his role in both films. The two sequels both earned over $1 billion worldwide, making the Batman series the second (and one of only two, the other being the
      <a href="/wiki/Pirates_of_the_Caribbean_(film_series)" title="Pirates of the Caribbean (film series)">
       <i>
        Pirates of the Caribbean
       </i>
       series
      </a>
      ) to have two of its films earn more than $1 billion worldwide.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-1">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        1
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      Batman has also appeared in multiple animated films, both as a starring character and as an ensemble character. While most animated films were released
      <a href="/wiki/Direct-to-video" title="Direct-to-video">
       direct-to-video
      </a>
      , the 1993 animated feature
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Mask_of_the_Phantasm" title="Batman: Mask of the Phantasm">
        Batman: Mask of the Phantasm
       </a>
      </i>
      (based on the 1990s
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Animated_Series" title="Batman: The Animated Series">
        Batman: The Animated Series
       </a>
      </i>
      ) was released theatrically.
     </p>
     <p>
      Having earned a total of U.S. $1,900,844,295 the
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      series is the fifth-highest-grossing film series in North America.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2">
       <a href="#cite_note-2">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        2
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
     </p>
     <div class="toc" id="toc">

     <p>
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Early_films_.26_serials">
       Early films &amp; serials
      </span>
     </h2>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_.281943.29">
       <i>
        Batman
       </i>
       (1943)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_(serial)" title="Batman (serial)">
       Batman (serial)
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      was a 15-chapter
      <a href="/wiki/Serial_film" title="Serial film">
       serial film
      </a>
      released in 1943 by
      <a href="/wiki/Columbia_Pictures" title="Columbia Pictures">
       Columbia Pictures
      </a>
      . The serial starred
      <a href="/wiki/Lewis_Wilson" title="Lewis Wilson">
       Lewis Wilson
      </a>
      as Batman and
      <a href="/wiki/Douglas_Croft" title="Douglas Croft">
       Douglas Croft
      </a>
      as Robin.
      <a href="/wiki/J._Carrol_Naish" title="J. Carrol Naish">
       J. Carrol Naish
      </a>
      played the villain, an original character named Dr. Daka. Rounding out the cast were
      <a href="/wiki/Shirley_Patterson" title="Shirley Patterson">
       Shirley Patterson
      </a>
      as Linda Page (Bruce Wayne's love interest), and
      <a href="/wiki/William_Austin_(actor)" title="William Austin (actor)">
       William Austin
      </a>
      as
      <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Pennyworth" title="Alfred Pennyworth">
       Alfred
      </a>
      . The plot is based on Batman, a US government agent, attempting to defeat the Japanese agent Dr. Daka, at the height of
      <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">
       World War II
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      The film is notable for being the first filmed appearance of Batman and for providing two core elements of the Batman mythos.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Daniels_3-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Daniels-3">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        3
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      The film introduced "The Bat's Cave" and the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Grandfather_clock" title="Grandfather clock">
       Grandfather clock
      </a>
      entrance.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Daniels_3-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Daniels-3">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        3
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      The name was altered to the
      <a href="/wiki/Batcave" title="Batcave">
       Batcave
      </a>
      for the comic. William Austin, who played Alfred, had a trim physique and sported a thin mustache, while the contemporary comic book version of Alfred was overweight and clean-shaven prior to the serial's release. The comics version of Alfred was altered to match that of Austin's, and has stayed that way.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Daniels_3-2">
       <a href="#cite_note-Daniels-3">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        3
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_and_Robin_.281949.29">
       <i>
        Batman and Robin
       </i>
       (1949)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_and_Robin_(serial)" title="Batman and Robin (serial)">
       Batman and Robin (serial)
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      <i>
       Batman and Robin
      </i>
      was another 15-chapter serial film released in 1949 by
      <a href="/wiki/Columbia_Pictures" title="Columbia Pictures">
       Columbia Pictures
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Robert_Lowery_(actor)" title="Robert Lowery (actor)">
       Robert Lowery
      </a>
      played Batman, while
      <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Duncan_(actor)" title="Johnny Duncan (actor)">
       Johnny Duncan
      </a>
      played Robin. Supporting players included
      <a href="/wiki/Poni_Adams" title="Poni Adams">
       Jane Adams
      </a>
      as
      <a href="/wiki/Vicki_Vale" title="Vicki Vale">
       Vicki Vale
      </a>
      and veteran character actor
      <a href="/wiki/Lyle_Talbot" title="Lyle Talbot">
       Lyle Talbot
      </a>
      as
      <a href="/wiki/James_Gordon_(comics)" title="James Gordon (comics)">
       Commissioner Gordon
      </a>
      . The plot dealt with the Dynamic Duo facing off against the Wizard, a hooded villain whose identity remains a mystery throughout the serial until the end.
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_.281966.29">
       <i>
        Batman
       </i>
       (1966)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1966_film)" title="Batman (1966 film)">
       Batman (1966 film)
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      (also known as
      <i>
       Batman: The Movie
      </i>
      ) is a 1966 film adaptation of the popular
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_(TV_series)" title="Batman (TV series)">
       <i>
        Batman
       </i>
       television series
      </a>
      , and was the first full-length theatrical adaptation of the
      <a href="/wiki/DC_Comics" title="DC Comics">
       DC Comics
      </a>
      character. The
      <a href="/wiki/20th_Century_Fox" title="20th Century Fox">
       20th Century Fox
      </a>
      release starred
      <a href="/wiki/Adam_West" title="Adam West">
       Adam West
      </a>
      as
      <a href="/wiki/Batman" title="Batman">
       Batman
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Burt_Ward" title="Burt Ward">
       Burt Ward
      </a>
      as
      <a href="/wiki/Robin_(comics)" title="Robin (comics)">
       Robin
      </a>
      , as well as
      <a href="/wiki/Cesar_Romero" title="Cesar Romero">
       Cesar Romero
      </a>
      as
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Joker" title="The Joker">
       the Joker
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Burgess_Meredith" title="Burgess Meredith">
       Burgess Meredith
      </a>
      as
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Penguin" title="The Penguin">
       the Penguin
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Lee_Meriwether" title="Lee Meriwether">
       Lee Meriwether
      </a>
      as
      <a href="/wiki/Catwoman" title="Catwoman">
       Catwoman
      </a>
      , and
      <a href="/wiki/Frank_Gorshin" title="Frank Gorshin">
       Frank Gorshin
      </a>
      as
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Riddler" title="The Riddler">
       the Riddler
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      The film was directed by
      <a href="/wiki/Leslie_H._Martinson" title="Leslie H. Martinson">
       Leslie H. Martinson
      </a>
      , who also directed a pair of
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_(TV_series)" title="Batman (TV series)">
        Batman
       </a>
      </i>
      episodes: "The Penguin Goes Straight" and "Not Yet, He Ain't," both from season one.
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Tim_Burton.2FJoel_Schumacher">
       Tim Burton/Joel Schumacher
      </span>
     </h2>
     <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-move" role="presentation">
      <tr>
       <td class="mbox-image">
        <div style="width:52px;">
         <img alt="" data-file-height="20" data-file-width="40" height="20" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Splitsection.svg/40px-Splitsection.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Splitsection.svg/60px-Splitsection.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Splitsection.svg/80px-Splitsection.svg.png 2x" width="40"/>
        </div>
       </td>
       <td class="mbox-text">
        <span class="mbox-text-span">
         It has been suggested that this section be
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Splitting" title="Wikipedia:Splitting">
          split
         </a>
         into a new article. (
         <a href="/wiki/Talk:Batman_in_film#Split_into_multiple_articles" title="Talk:Batman in film">
          Discuss
         </a>
         )
         <small>
          <i>
           Proposed since February 2014.
          </i>
         </small>
        </span>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_.281989.29">
       <i>
        Batman
       </i>
       (1989)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="thumb tright">
      <div class="thumbinner" style="width:177px;">
       <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Keaton_as_Batman.jpg">
        <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="347" data-file-width="250" height="243" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/d/df/Keaton_as_Batman.jpg/175px-Keaton_as_Batman.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/d/df/Keaton_as_Batman.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/d/df/Keaton_as_Batman.jpg 2x" width="175"/>
       </a>
       <div class="thumbcaption">
        <div class="magnify">
         <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Keaton_as_Batman.jpg" title="Enlarge">
         </a>
        </div>
        <a href="/wiki/Michael_Keaton" title="Michael Keaton">
         Michael Keaton
        </a>
        as Batman.
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1989_film)" title="Batman (1989 film)">
       Batman (1989 film)
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      <a href="/wiki/Tim_Burton" title="Tim Burton">
       Tim Burton
      </a>
      took over as director of the first Batman film in 1986.
      <a href="/wiki/Steve_Englehart" title="Steve Englehart">
       Steve Englehart
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Julie_Hickson" title="Julie Hickson">
       Julie Hickson
      </a>
      wrote
      <a href="/wiki/Film_treatment" title="Film treatment">
       film treatments
      </a>
      before
      <a href="/wiki/Sam_Hamm" title="Sam Hamm">
       Sam Hamm
      </a>
      wrote the first screenplay.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Elfman_4-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Elfman-4">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        4
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Steve_5-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Steve-5">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        5
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Numerous
      <a href="/wiki/A-list" title="A-list">
       A-list
      </a>
      actors were considered for the role of Batman before
      <a href="/wiki/Michael_Keaton" title="Michael Keaton">
       Michael Keaton
      </a>
      was cast. Keaton was a controversial choice for the role since, by 1988, he had become
      <a href="/wiki/Typecasting_(acting)" title="Typecasting (acting)">
       typecast
      </a>
      as a comedic actor and many observers doubted he could portray a serious role.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Elfman_4-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Elfman-4">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        4
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Jack_Nicholson" title="Jack Nicholson">
       Jack Nicholson
      </a>
      accepted the role of the
      <a href="/wiki/Joker_(comics)" title="Joker (comics)">
       Joker
      </a>
      under strict conditions that dictated a high salary, a portion of the box office profits and his
      <a href="/wiki/Shooting_schedule" title="Shooting schedule">
       shooting schedule
      </a>
      . Nicholson's final salary is reported to be as high as $50 million.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Guber_6-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Guber-6">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        6
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Jones_7-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Jones-7">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        7
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Hamm_8-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Hamm-8">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        8
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-empire_9-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-empire-9">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        9
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Principal_photography" title="Principal photography">
       Principal photography
      </a>
      took place at
      <a href="/wiki/Pinewood_Studios" title="Pinewood Studios">
       Pinewood Studios
      </a>
      from October 1988 to January 1989.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Joe_10-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Joe-10">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        10
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      The budget escalated from $30 million to $48 million,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Guber_6-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Guber-6">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        6
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      while the
      <a href="/wiki/1988_Writers_Guild_of_America_strike" title="1988 Writers Guild of America strike">
       1988 Writers Guild of America strike
      </a>
      forced Hamm to drop out. Rewrites were performed by
      <a href="/wiki/Warren_Skaaren" title="Warren Skaaren">
       Warren Skaaren
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Charles_McKeown" title="Charles McKeown">
       Charles McKeown
      </a>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Jones_7-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Jones-7">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        7
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Jonathan_Gems" title="Jonathan Gems">
       Jonathan Gems
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11">
       <a href="#cite_note-11">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        11
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      received positive reviews, broke numerous box office records, and won the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Art_Direction" title="Academy Award for Best Art Direction">
       Academy Award for Best Art Direction
      </a>
      . The film grossed over $400 million,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Elfman_4-2">
       <a href="#cite_note-Elfman-4">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        4
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and left a legacy over the modern perception of the
      <a href="/wiki/Superhero_film" title="Superhero film">
       superhero film
      </a>
      genre.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12">
       <a href="#cite_note-12">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        12
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_Returns_.281992.29">
       <i>
        Batman Returns
       </i>
       (1992)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_Returns" title="Batman Returns">
       Batman Returns
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      Burton originally did not want to direct a sequel because of his mixed emotions over the previous film.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-production_13-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-production-13">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        13
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Sam_Hamm" title="Sam Hamm">
       Sam Hamm
      </a>
      's first script had
      <a href="/wiki/Penguin_(comics)" title="Penguin (comics)">
       Penguin
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Catwoman" title="Catwoman">
       Catwoman
      </a>
      searching for hidden treasure.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Mad_14-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Mad-14">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        14
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Waters_(screenwriter)" title="Daniel Waters (screenwriter)">
       Daniel Waters
      </a>
      delivered a script that satisfied Burton, which convinced him to direct the film.
      <a href="/wiki/Wesley_Strick" title="Wesley Strick">
       Wesley Strick
      </a>
      did an uncredited rewrite, deleting characterizations of
      <a href="/wiki/Two-Face" title="Two-Face">
       Harvey Dent
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Robin_(comics)" title="Robin (comics)">
       Robin
      </a>
      and rewriting the
      <a href="/wiki/Climax_(narrative)" title="Climax (narrative)">
       climax
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-beetle_15-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-beetle-15">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        15
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-stick_16-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-stick-16">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        16
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Various
      <a href="/wiki/A-list" title="A-list">
       A-list
      </a>
      actresses lobbied hard for the role of Catwoman before
      <a href="/wiki/Michelle_Pfeiffer" title="Michelle Pfeiffer">
       Michelle Pfeiffer
      </a>
      was cast, while
      <a href="/wiki/Danny_DeVito" title="Danny DeVito">
       Danny DeVito
      </a>
      signed on to portray the Penguin.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-17">
       <a href="#cite_note-17">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        17
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Filming started at Warner Bros. in
      <a href="/wiki/Burbank,_California" title="Burbank, California">
       Burbank, California
      </a>
      in June 1991.
      <i>
       Batman Returns
      </i>
      was released with financial success, but Warner Bros. was disappointed with the film's box office run because it earned less than its predecessor.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-boxy_18-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-boxy-18">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        18
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      However,
      <i>
       Batman Returns
      </i>
      was released to generally positive reviews,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-returnsrot_19-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-returnsrot-19">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        19
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      although a "parental backlash" criticized the film for containing violence and sexual
      <a href="/wiki/Innuendo" title="Innuendo">
       innuendos
      </a>
      that were thought to be unsuitable for children.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-boxy_18-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-boxy-18">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        18
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/McDonald%27s" title="McDonald's">
       McDonald's
      </a>
      shut down its
      <a href="/wiki/Happy_Meal" title="Happy Meal">
       Happy Meal
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/Tie-in" title="Tie-in">
       tie-in
      </a>
      for
      <i>
       Batman Returns
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-20">
       <a href="#cite_note-20">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        20
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_Forever_.281995.29">
       <i>
        Batman Forever
       </i>
       (1995)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_Forever" title="Batman Forever">
       Batman Forever
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      Although
      <i>
       Batman Returns
      </i>
      was a financial success, Warner Bros. felt the film should have made more money. The studio decided to change the direction of the
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      film series to be more
      <a href="/wiki/Mainstream" title="Mainstream">
       mainstream
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Joel_Schumacher" title="Joel Schumacher">
       Joel Schumacher
      </a>
      replaced
      <a href="/wiki/Tim_Burton" title="Tim Burton">
       Tim Burton
      </a>
      as director, while Burton decided to stay on as producer.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Russo_21-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Russo-21">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        21
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      However,
      <a href="/wiki/Michael_Keaton" title="Michael Keaton">
       Michael Keaton
      </a>
      did not like the new direction the film series was heading in,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Val_22-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Val-22">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        22
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and was replaced by
      <a href="/wiki/Val_Kilmer" title="Val Kilmer">
       Val Kilmer
      </a>
      as Batman.
      <a href="/wiki/Chris_O%27Donnell" title="Chris O'Donnell">
       Chris O'Donnell
      </a>
      was introduced as
      <a href="/wiki/Robin_(comics)" title="Robin (comics)">
       Robin
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Jim_Carrey" title="Jim Carrey">
       Jim Carrey
      </a>
      starred as
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Riddler" title="The Riddler">
       The Riddler
      </a>
      , while
      <a href="/wiki/Tommy_Lee_Jones" title="Tommy Lee Jones">
       Tommy Lee Jones
      </a>
      starred as
      <a href="/wiki/Two-Face" title="Two-Face">
       Two-Face
      </a>
      . Filming started in September 1994,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Russo_21-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Russo-21">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        21
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and Schumacher encountered problems communicating with Kilmer and Jones.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-23">
       <a href="#cite_note-23">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        23
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <i>
       Batman Forever
      </i>
      was released on June 16, 1995 with financial success, earning over $350 million worldwide and three Academy Award nominations, but the film was met with mixed reviews from critics.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-forevermojo_24-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-forevermojo-24">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        24
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-foreverotten_25-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-foreverotten-25">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        25
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_.26_Robin_.281997.29">
       <i>
        Batman &amp; Robin
       </i>
       (1997)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_%26_Robin_(film)" title="Batman &amp; Robin (film)">
       Batman &amp; Robin (film)
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      After the release of
      <i>
       Batman Forever
      </i>
      , Warner Bros. started development on
      <i>
       Batman &amp; Robin
      </i>
      , commissioning it on fast track for an adamant June 1997 release.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-helm_26-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-helm-26">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        26
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Val Kilmer did not return, because of scheduling conflicts with
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Saint_(film)" title="The Saint (film)">
        The Saint
       </a>
      </i>
      ,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-shadow_27-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-shadow-27">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        27
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and was replaced by
      <a href="/wiki/George_Clooney" title="George Clooney">
       George Clooney
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Arnold_Schwarzenegger" title="Arnold Schwarzenegger">
       Arnold Schwarzenegger
      </a>
      starred as
      <a href="/wiki/Mr._Freeze" title="Mr. Freeze">
       Mr. Freeze
      </a>
      , while
      <a href="/wiki/Uma_Thurman" title="Uma Thurman">
       Uma Thurman
      </a>
      starred as
      <a href="/wiki/Poison_Ivy_(comics)" title="Poison Ivy (comics)">
       Poison Ivy
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Alicia_Silverstone" title="Alicia Silverstone">
       Alicia Silverstone
      </a>
      starred as
      <a href="/wiki/Batgirl" title="Batgirl">
       Batgirl
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Chris_O%27Donnell" title="Chris O'Donnell">
       Chris O'Donnell
      </a>
      reprised his role as
      <a href="/wiki/Robin_(comics)" title="Robin (comics)">
       Robin
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Principal_photography" title="Principal photography">
       Principal photography
      </a>
      began in September 1996
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-28">
       <a href="#cite_note-28">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        28
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and finished in January 1997,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-29">
       <a href="#cite_note-29">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        29
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      two weeks ahead of the
      <a href="/wiki/Shooting_schedule" title="Shooting schedule">
       shooting schedule
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-mike_30-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-mike-30">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        30
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <i>
       Batman &amp; Robin
      </i>
      was released on June 20, 1997, and received primarily negative reviews.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-rottenbr_31-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-rottenbr-31">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        31
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Observers criticized the film for its
      <a href="/wiki/Toyetic" title="Toyetic">
       toyetic
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Camp_(style)" title="Camp (style)">
       campy
      </a>
      approach, and for homosexual
      <a href="/wiki/Innuendo" title="Innuendo">
       innuendos
      </a>
      added by Schumacher.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-shadow_27-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-shadow-27">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        27
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Still, the film was a financial success,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-market_32-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-market-32">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        32
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      but remains to be the least commercially successful live-action
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      film ever.
      <i>
       Batman &amp; Robin
      </i>
      received numerous nominations at the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Golden_Raspberry_Award" title="Golden Raspberry Award">
       Razzie Awards
      </a>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-33">
       <a href="#cite_note-33">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        33
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and ranks among the worst rated
      <a href="/wiki/Superhero_film" title="Superhero film">
       superhero films
      </a>
      of all time.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-34">
       <a href="#cite_note-34">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        34
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-35">
       <a href="#cite_note-35">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        35
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Christopher_Nolan">
       Christopher Nolan
      </span>
     </h2>
     <table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-move" role="presentation">
      <tr>
       <td class="mbox-image">
        <div style="width:52px;">
         <img alt="" data-file-height="20" data-file-width="40" height="20" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Splitsection.svg/40px-Splitsection.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Splitsection.svg/60px-Splitsection.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ea/Splitsection.svg/80px-Splitsection.svg.png 2x" width="40"/>
        </div>
       </td>
       <td class="mbox-text">
        <span class="mbox-text-span">
         It has been suggested that this section be
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Splitting" title="Wikipedia:Splitting">
          split
         </a>
         into a new article. (
         <a href="/wiki/Talk:Batman_in_film#Split_into_multiple_articles" title="Talk:Batman in film">
          Discuss
         </a>
         )
         <small>
          <i>
           Proposed since December 2013.
          </i>
         </small>
        </span>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_Begins_.282005.29">
       <i>
        Batman Begins
       </i>
       (2005)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_Begins" title="Batman Begins">
       Batman Begins
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      Director/writer
      <a href="/wiki/Christopher_Nolan" title="Christopher Nolan">
       Christopher Nolan
      </a>
      and co-writer
      <a href="/wiki/David_S._Goyer" title="David S. Goyer">
       David S. Goyer
      </a>
      began work on
      <i>
       Batman Begins
      </i>
      in early 2003
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-capture_36-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-capture-36">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        36
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and aimed for a darker and more realistic tone, with humanity and realism being the basis of the film.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-beautiful_37-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-beautiful-37">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        37
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      The film, which was primarily shot in the United Kingdom and Chicago,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-38">
       <a href="#cite_note-38">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        38
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-EMP_39-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-EMP-39">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        39
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      relied on traditional stunts and
      <a href="/wiki/Scale_model" title="Scale model">
       scale models
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Computer-generated_imagery" title="Computer-generated imagery">
       Computer-generated imagery
      </a>
      was used minimally.
      <a href="/wiki/Christian_Bale" title="Christian Bale">
       Christian Bale
      </a>
      starred as Batman,
      <a href="/wiki/Liam_Neeson" title="Liam Neeson">
       Liam Neeson
      </a>
      starred as
      <a href="/wiki/Ra%27s_al_Ghul" title="Ra's al Ghul">
       Ra's al Ghul
      </a>
      , and
      <a href="/wiki/Cillian_Murphy" title="Cillian Murphy">
       Cillian Murphy
      </a>
      starred as
      <a href="/wiki/Scarecrow_(DC_Comics)" title="Scarecrow (DC Comics)">
       The Scarecrow
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Katie_Holmes" title="Katie Holmes">
       Katie Holmes
      </a>
      also starred in the movie as Bruce's love interest,
      <a href="/wiki/Rachel_Dawes" title="Rachel Dawes">
       Rachel Dawes
      </a>
      , a role created for the film. A new
      <a href="/wiki/Batmobile" title="Batmobile">
       Batmobile
      </a>
      (called
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batmobile_(Batman_Begins)" title="Batmobile (Batman Begins)">
       the Tumbler
      </a>
      ) and a more mobile
      <a href="/wiki/Batsuit" title="Batsuit">
       Batsuit
      </a>
      were both created specifically for the film.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-batmobile_40-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-batmobile-40">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        40
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-batsuit_41-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-batsuit-41">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        41
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      <i>
       Batman Begins
      </i>
      was both critically and commercially successful. The film opened on June 15, 2005, in the United States and Canada in 3,858theaters. It grossed $48million in its opening weekend, eventually grossing over $372million worldwide. The film received an 85% overall approval rating from
      <a href="/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes" title="Rotten Tomatoes">
       Rotten Tomatoes
      </a>
