      . Critics noted that fear was a common motif throughout the film, and remarked that it had a darker tone compared with previous
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      films. The film was nominated for the
      <a href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Cinematography" title="Academy Award for Best Cinematography">
       Academy Award for Best Cinematography
      </a>
      and for three
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/BAFTA" title="BAFTA">
       BAFTA
      </a>
      awards.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-imdbawards_42-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-imdbawards-42">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        42
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      It was also listed at No. 81 on
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Empire_Magazine" title="Empire Magazine">
       <i>
        Empire
       </i>
      </a>
      's "500 Greatest Movies of All Time"
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-43">
       <a href="#cite_note-43">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        43
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and has maintained a standing on
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/IMDb.com" title="IMDb.com">
       IMDb.com
      </a>
      's "Top 250".
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-44">
       <a href="#cite_note-44">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        44
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="The_Dark_Knight_.282008.29">
       <i>
        The Dark Knight
       </i>
       (2008)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_(film)" title="The Dark Knight (film)">
       The Dark Knight (film)
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      Christopher Nolan reprised his duties as director, and brought his brother,
      <a href="/wiki/Jonathan_Nolan" title="Jonathan Nolan">
       Jonathan
      </a>
      , to co-write the script for the second installment.
      <i>
       The Dark Knight
      </i>
      featured Christian Bale reprising his role as Batman/Bruce Wayne,
      <a href="/wiki/Heath_Ledger" title="Heath Ledger">
       Heath Ledger
      </a>
      as
      <a href="/wiki/Joker_(comics)" title="Joker (comics)">
       The Joker
      </a>
      , and
      <a href="/wiki/Aaron_Eckhart" title="Aaron Eckhart">
       Aaron Eckhart
      </a>
      as
      <a href="/wiki/Two-Face" title="Two-Face">
       Harvey Dent / Two-Face
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Principal_photography" title="Principal photography">
       Principal photography
      </a>
      began in April 2007 in Chicago and concluded in November. Other locations included
      <a href="/wiki/Pinewood_Studios" title="Pinewood Studios">
       Pinewood Studios
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Sound" title="Ministry of Sound">
       Ministry of Sound
      </a>
      in London and Hong Kong. On January 22, 2008, after he had completed filming
      <i>
       The Dark Knight
      </i>
      , Ledger died from a bad combination of prescription medication.
      <a href="/wiki/Warner_Bros." title="Warner Bros.">
       Warner Bros.
      </a>
      had created a
      <a href="/wiki/Viral_marketing" title="Viral marketing">
       viral marketing
      </a>
      campaign for
      <i>
       The Dark Knight
      </i>
      , developing promotional websites and trailers highlighting screen shots of Ledger as the Joker, but after Ledger's death, the studio refocused its promotional campaign.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-45">
       <a href="#cite_note-45">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        45
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-46">
       <a href="#cite_note-46">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        46
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      The film received highly positive reviews,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Paste_47-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Paste-47">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        47
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Metadecade_48-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Metadecade-48">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        48
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Empiredecade_49-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Empiredecade-49">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        49
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and set numerous records during its theatrical run.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-50">
       <a href="#cite_note-50">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        50
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      With over $1billion in revenue worldwide, it is the
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_highest-grossing_films" title="List of highest-grossing films">
       sixteenth-highest-grossing film
      </a>
      of all time, unadjusted for inflation.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-51">
       <a href="#cite_note-51">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        51
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      The film received eight
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Academy_Award" title="Academy Award">
       Academy Award
      </a>
      nominations; it won the award for
      <a href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Sound_Editing" title="Academy Award for Best Sound Editing">
       Best Sound Editing
      </a>
      and Ledger was posthumously awarded
      <a href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Supporting_Actor" title="Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor">
       Best Supporting Actor
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="The_Dark_Knight_Rises_.282012.29">
       <i>
        The Dark Knight Rises
       </i>
       (2012)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_Rises" title="The Dark Knight Rises">
       The Dark Knight Rises
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      Nolan wanted the story for the third and final installment to keep him emotionally invested. "On a more superficial level, I have to ask the question," he reasoned, "how many good third movies in a franchise can people name?"
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-52">
       <a href="#cite_note-52">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        52
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      He returned out of finding a necessary way to continue the story, but feared midway through filming he would find a sequel redundant.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-53">
       <a href="#cite_note-53">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        53
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <i>
       The Dark Knight Rises
      </i>
      is intended to complete Nolan's
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      trilogy.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-54">
       <a href="#cite_note-54">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        54
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      By December 2008, Nolan completed a rough story outline, before he committed himself to
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Inception" title="Inception">
        Inception
       </a>
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-55">
       <a href="#cite_note-55">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        55
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      In February 2010, work on the screenplay was commencing with
      <a href="/wiki/David_S._Goyer" title="David S. Goyer">
       David S. Goyer
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Jonathan_Nolan" title="Jonathan Nolan">
       Jonathan Nolan
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-56">
       <a href="#cite_note-56">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        56
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      When Goyer left to work on the
      <a href="/wiki/Man_of_Steel_(film)" title="Man of Steel (film)">
       <i>
        Superman
       </i>
       reboot
      </a>
      , Jonathan was writing the script based on the story by his brother and Goyer.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-57">
       <a href="#cite_note-57">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        57
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Tom_Hardy" title="Tom Hardy">
       Tom Hardy
      </a>
      was cast as
      <a href="/wiki/Bane_(comics)" title="Bane (comics)">
       Bane
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Anne_Hathaway" title="Anne Hathaway">
       Anne Hathaway
      </a>
      plays
      <a href="/wiki/Catwoman" title="Catwoman">
       Selina Kyle
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-58">
       <a href="#cite_note-58">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        58
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Joseph_Gordon-Levitt" title="Joseph Gordon-Levitt">
       Joseph Gordon-Levitt
      </a>
      was cast as
      <a href="/wiki/Robin_in_other_media#The_Dark_Knight_Rises" title="Robin in other media">
       John Blake
      </a>
      ,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-variety3-18_59-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-variety3-18-59">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        59
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-60">
       <a href="#cite_note-60">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        60
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Marion_Cotillard" title="Marion Cotillard">
       Marion Cotillard
      </a>
      was cast as
      <a href="/wiki/Talia_al_Ghul" title="Talia al Ghul">
       Miranda Tate
      </a>
      . Filming began in May 2011 and concluded in November.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-61">
       <a href="#cite_note-61">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        61
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Nolan chose not to film in
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/3-D_film" title="3-D film">
       3-D
      </a>
      but, by focusing on improving image quality and scale using the
      <a href="/wiki/IMAX" title="IMAX">
       IMAX
      </a>
      format, hoped to push technological boundaries while nevertheless making the style of the film consistent with the previous two.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-release_62-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-release-62">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        62
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Nolan had several meetings with IMAX Vice-President David Keighley to work on the logistics of projecting films in digital IMAX venues.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ColliderIMAX_63-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-ColliderIMAX-63">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        63
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <i>
       The Dark Knight Rises
      </i>
      featured more scenes shot in IMAX than
      <i>
       The Dark Knight
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ColliderIMAX_63-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-ColliderIMAX-63">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        63
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Cinematographer
      <a href="/wiki/Wally_Pfister" title="Wally Pfister">
       Wally Pfister
      </a>
      expressed interest in shooting the film entirely in IMAX.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-64">
       <a href="#cite_note-64">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        64
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-65">
       <a href="#cite_note-65">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        65
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      Upon release,
      <i>
       The Dark Knight Rises
      </i>
      received a positive critical response and was successful at the box office, going on to outgross its predecessor and become the
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_highest-grossing_films" title="List of highest-grossing films">
       tenth-highest-grossing film of all time
      </a>
      grossing over $1.08 billion. However, unlike its predecessors, the film was not nominated for any Oscars during its year of eligibility at the
      <a href="/wiki/85th_Academy_Awards" title="85th Academy Awards">
       85th Academy Awards
      </a>
      , much to the surprise of film industry insiders.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-66">
       <a href="#cite_note-66">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        66
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="DC_Cinematic_Universe">
       DC Cinematic Universe
      </span>
     </h2>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_v_Superman:_Dawn_of_Justice_.282016.29">
       <i>
        Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
       </i>
       (2016)
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_v_Superman:_Dawn_of_Justice" title="Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice">
       Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      On June 13, 2013, a source from Warner Bros. told
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Wrap" title="The Wrap">
        The Wrap
       </a>
      </i>
      that they're discussing the possibilities with mention of more
      <i>
       Man of Steel
      </i>
      films as well as a Superman/Batman film, Wonder Woman, and Aquaman.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-67">
       <a href="#cite_note-67">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        67
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Warner Bros. announced that Superman and Batman will unite in a new film which will be the follow-up to
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Man_of_Steel_(film)" title="Man of Steel (film)">
        Man of Steel
       </a>
      </i>
      (2013), set for release in 2015.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-68">
       <a href="#cite_note-68">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        68
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-69">
       <a href="#cite_note-69">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        69
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      According to Snyder, the film will take inspiration from the comic
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_Returns" title="The Dark Knight Returns">
        The Dark Knight Returns
       </a>
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-70">
       <a href="#cite_note-70">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        70
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Goyer stated at the Superman 75th Anniversary Panel at Comic-Con, that Superman and Batman would face off, and titles under consideration are
      <i>
       Superman vs Batman
      </i>
      or
      <i>
       Batman vs Superman
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-71">
       <a href="#cite_note-71">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        71
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Production of the film will start filming in
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Toronto,_Ontario" title="Toronto, Ontario">
       Toronto, Ontario
      </a>
      instead of Vancouver in 2014.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-72">
       <a href="#cite_note-72">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        72
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      On August 22, 2013,
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/The_Hollywood_Reporter" title="The Hollywood Reporter">
        The Hollywood Reporter
       </a>
      </i>
      announced the casting of
      <a href="/wiki/Ben_Affleck" title="Ben Affleck">
       Ben Affleck
      </a>
      as Bruce Wayne/
      <a href="/wiki/Batman" title="Batman">
       Batman
      </a>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-73">
       <a href="#cite_note-73">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        73
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-74">
       <a href="#cite_note-74">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        74
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      On January 17, 2014, it was announced that the film had been delayed from its original July 17, 2015 release date to May 6, 2016, in order to give the filmmakers "time to realize fully their vision, given the complex visual nature of the story".
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-75">
       <a href="#cite_note-75">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        75
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      It got moved again to March 25, 2016.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-March2016Release_76-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-March2016Release-76">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        76
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Justice_League">
       <i>
        Justice League
       </i>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote boilerplate seealso">
      See also:
      <a href="/wiki/Justice_League_in_other_media#Film" title="Justice League in other media">
       Justice League in other media  Film
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      Shortly after filming had finished for
      <i>
       Man of Steel
      </i>
      , Warner Bros hired
      <a href="/wiki/Will_Beall" title="Will Beall">
       Will Beall
      </a>
      to script a new
      <i>
       Justice League
      </i>
      film in June 2012.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-77">
       <a href="#cite_note-77">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        77
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      With the release of
      <i>
       Man of Steel
      </i>
      in June 2013, Goyer was hired to write a new
      <i>
       Justice League
      </i>
      script, with the Beall draft being scrapped.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-78">
       <a href="#cite_note-78">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        78
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      In April 2014 it was announced that
      <a href="/wiki/Zack_Snyder" title="Zack Snyder">
       Zack Snyder
      </a>
      would also be directing Goyer's
      <i>
       Justice League
      </i>
      script.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-79">
       <a href="#cite_note-79">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        79
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Warner Bros. was reportedly courting
      <a href="/wiki/Chris_Terrio" title="Chris Terrio">
       Chris Terrio
      </a>
      to rewrite
      <i>
       Justice League
      </i>
      the following July, after having been impressed with his rewrite of
      <i>
       Batman v Superman
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-80">
       <a href="#cite_note-80">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        80
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Unproduced">
       Unproduced
      </span>
     </h2>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_Triumphant">
       <i>
        Batman Triumphant
       </i>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <p>
      During the filming of
      <i>
       Batman &amp; Robin
      </i>
      , Warner Bros. was impressed with the
      <a href="/wiki/Dailies" title="Dailies">
       dailies
      </a>
      , prompting them to immediately hire Joel Schumacher to reprise his directing duties for a third film. Writer
      <a href="/wiki/Akiva_Goldsman" title="Akiva Goldsman">
       Akiva Goldsman
      </a>
      , who worked on
      <i>
       Batman Forever
      </i>
      and
      <i>
       Batman &amp; Robin
      </i>
      , turned down the chance to write the script.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-mike_30-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-mike-30">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        30
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      In late 1996, Warner Bros. and Schumacher hired
      <a href="/wiki/Mark_Protosevich" title="Mark Protosevich">
       Mark Protosevich
      </a>
      to write the script for a fifth
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      film. A projected mid-1999 release date was announced.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-81">
       <a href="#cite_note-81">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        81
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Titled
      <i>
       Batman Triumphant
      </i>
      , Protosevich's script had
      <a href="/wiki/Scarecrow_(DC_Comics)" title="Scarecrow (DC Comics)">
       the Scarecrow
      </a>
      as the main villain and
      <a href="/wiki/Joker_(comics)" title="Joker (comics)">
       the Joker
      </a>
      would return as a hallucination in Batman's mind caused by the Scarecrow's fear
      <a href="/wiki/Toxin" title="Toxin">
       toxin
      </a>
      .
      <a href="/wiki/Harley_Quinn" title="Harley Quinn">
       Harley Quinn
      </a>
      appeared as a supporting character, written as the
      <a href="/wiki/Duela_Dent" title="Duela Dent">
       Joker's daughter
      </a>
      trying to kill Batman to avenge her father's death.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-82">
       <a href="#cite_note-82">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        82
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/George_Clooney" title="George Clooney">
       George Clooney
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Chris_O%27Donnell" title="Chris O'Donnell">
       Chris O'Donnell
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Alicia_Silverstone" title="Alicia Silverstone">
       Alicia Silverstone
      </a>
      were set to reprise the roles of Batman, Robin, and Batgirl.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-83">
       <a href="#cite_note-83">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        83
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Schumacher had also approached
      <a href="/wiki/Nicolas_Cage" title="Nicolas Cage">
       Nicolas Cage
      </a>
      for the role of Scarecrow.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-84">
       <a href="#cite_note-84">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        84
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      However, when
      <i>
       Batman &amp; Robin
      </i>
      received negative reviews and failed to outgross any of its predecessors, Warner Bros. was unsure of their plans for
      <i>
       Batman Triumphant
      </i>
      . The studio decided it was best to consider a live-action
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Beyond" title="Batman Beyond">
        Batman Beyond
       </a>
      </i>
      film and an adaptation of
      <a href="/wiki/Frank_Miller_(comics)" title="Frank Miller (comics)">
       Frank Miller
      </a>
      's
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Year_One" title="Batman: Year One">
        Batman: Year One
       </a>
      </i>
      . Warner Bros. would then
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Greenlight" title="Greenlight">
       greenlight
      </a>
      whichever idea suited them the most.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ass_85-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-ass-85">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        85
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Schumacher felt he "owe[d] the Batman culture a real
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      movie. I would go back to the basics and make a dark portrayal of the Dark Knight."
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Jen_86-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Jen-86">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        86
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      He approached Warner Bros. to do
      <i>
       Batman: Year One
      </i>
      in mid-1998.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Jen_86-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Jen-86">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        86
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Robin_spinoff">
       <i>
        Robin
       </i>
       spinoff
      </span>
     </h3>
     <p>
      Chris O'Donnell revealed in a 2012 interview with
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Access_Hollywood" title="Access Hollywood">
        Access Hollywood
       </a>
      </i>
      that a Robin spin-off was planned but was scrapped after
      <i>
       Batman &amp; Robin
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-87">
       <a href="#cite_note-87">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        87
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman:_DarKnight">
       <i>
        Batman: DarKnight
       </i>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <p>
      Despite Warner Bros. and Schumacher's interest with
      <i>
       Year One
      </i>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Lee_Shapiro_(writer)" title="Lee Shapiro (writer)">
       Lee Shapiro
      </a>
      , a comic book fan, and Stephen Wise
      <a href="/wiki/Pitch_(filmmaking)" title="Pitch (filmmaking)">
       pitched
      </a>
      the studio with a script titled
      <i>
       Batman: DarKnight
      </i>
      in mid-1998.
      <i>
       DarKnight
      </i>
      had Bruce Wayne giving up his crime fighting career, and Dick Grayson attending Gotham University.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Lee_88-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Lee-88">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        88
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Scarecrow_(DC_Comics)" title="Scarecrow (DC Comics)">
       Dr. Jonathan Crane
      </a>
      uses his position as professor of psychology at Gotham University and as head psychiatrist at
      <a href="/wiki/Arkham_Asylum" title="Arkham Asylum">
       Arkham Asylum
      </a>
      to conduct his experiments into fear (this element would later appear in
      <i>
       Batman Begins
      </i>
      ). During a vengeful confrontation with a colleague, Dr. Kirk Langstrom, Crane unknowingly initiates Kirk's transformation into the creature known as
      <a href="/wiki/Man-Bat" title="Man-Bat">
       Man-Bat
      </a>
      . Citizens of Gotham believe Man-Bat's nightly activities to be Batman's "bloodthirsty" return. Bruce becomes Batman "to clear his name," and solve the mystery of Man-Bat.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Lee_88-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Lee-88">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        88
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Kirk struggles with his "man-vs.-monster" syndrome, as he longs to both reunite with his wife and get revenge on Crane, while Crane exacts revenge on those responsible for his dismissal from both Arkham and the university while encountering truths about his past. Warner Bros. decided not to move forward with the project, and passed on
      <i>
       Batman: DarKnight
      </i>
      in favor of
      <i>
       Year One
      </i>
      and
      <i>
       Batman Beyond
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Lee_88-2">
       <a href="#cite_note-Lee-88">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        88
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman:_Year_One_.26_Batman_Beyond">
       <i>
        Batman: Year One
       </i>
       &amp;
       <i>
        Batman Beyond
       </i>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <p>
      In January 2000,
      <a href="/wiki/Scott_Rosenberg" title="Scott Rosenberg">
       Scott Rosenberg
      </a>
      turned down the chance to write the script for
      <i>
       Batman: Year One
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-89">
       <a href="#cite_note-89">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        89
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      By the following September, Warner Bros. was developing a live action screen adaptation of
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Beyond" title="Batman Beyond">
        Batman Beyond
       </a>
      </i>
      , written by
      <a href="/wiki/Paul_Dini" title="Paul Dini">
       Paul Dini
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Neal_Stephenson" title="Neal Stephenson">
       Neal Stephenson
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Boaz_Yakin" title="Boaz Yakin">
       Boaz Yakin
      </a>
      , with the possibility of Yakin directing, as well as an adaptation of
      <a href="/wiki/Frank_Miller_(comics)" title="Frank Miller (comics)">
       Frank Miller
      </a>
      's 1987 comic book story arc
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Year_One" title="Batman: Year One">
        Batman: Year One
       </a>
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dana_90-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Dana-90">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        90
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Despite interest from Schumacher,
      <a href="/wiki/Darren_Aronofsky" title="Darren Aronofsky">
       Darren Aronofsky
      </a>
      was hired to direct and co-write with Miller,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Jen_86-2">
       <a href="#cite_note-Jen-86">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        86
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dana_90-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Dana-90">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        90
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      whom he previouslyl collaborated with on an unproduced script for
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Ronin_(DC_Comics)" title="Ronin (DC Comics)">
        Ronin
       </a>
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-91">
       <a href="#cite_note-91">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        91
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Yakin developed one draft of the
      <i>
       Batman Beyond
      </i>
      screenplay with the writers but soon lost interest,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-92">
       <a href="#cite_note-92">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        92
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and Warner Bros. abandoned
      <i>
       Batman Beyond
      </i>
      almost instantly in favor of
      <i>
       Batman: Year One
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ass_85-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-ass-85">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        85
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Aronofsky and Miller intended to
      <a href="/wiki/Reboot_(fiction)" title="Reboot (fiction)">
       reboot
      </a>
      the
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      franchise, "it's
      <i>
       somewhat
      </i>
      based on the comic book," Aronofsky said. "Toss out everything you can imagine about Batman! Everything! We're starting completely anew."
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-93">
       <a href="#cite_note-93">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        93
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Regular Aronofsky collaborator,
      <a href="/wiki/Matthew_Libatique" title="Matthew Libatique">
       Matthew Libatique
      </a>
      , was set as
      <a href="/wiki/Cinematographer" title="Cinematographer">
       cinematographer
      </a>
      ,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-94">
       <a href="#cite_note-94">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        94
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Christian_Bale" title="Christian Bale">
       Christian Bale
      </a>
      had been approached for the role of Batman. Coincidentally, Bale would be cast in the role for
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Batman_Begins" title="Batman Begins">
        Batman Begins
       </a>
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-95">
       <a href="#cite_note-95">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        95
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      At the same time, Warner Bros. was moving forward on a
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Catwoman_(film)" title="Catwoman (film)">
        Catwoman
       </a>
      </i>
      spin-off.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-96">
       <a href="#cite_note-96">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        96
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      However, by June 2002, the studio decided to move forward on
      <i>
       Batman vs. Superman
      </i>
      and abandon
      <i>
       Year One
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-97">
       <a href="#cite_note-97">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        97
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_vs._Superman">
       <i>
        Batman vs. Superman
       </i>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <p>
      Warner Bros. abandoned
      <a href="/wiki/J._J._Abrams" title="J. J. Abrams">
       J. J. Abrams
      </a>
      ' script for
      <i>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Superman:_Flyby" title="Superman: Flyby">
        Superman: Flyby
       </a>
      </i>
      , which had been
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Greenlight" title="Greenlight">
       greenlighted
      </a>
      with
      <a href="/wiki/McG" title="McG">
       McG
      </a>
      to direct.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-reboot_98-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-reboot-98">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        98
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-99">
       <a href="#cite_note-99">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        99
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      When McG dropped out in favor of
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Charlie%27s_Angels:_Full_Throttle" title="Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle">
        Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
       </a>
      </i>
      ,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Stallville_100-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Stallville-100">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        100
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Warner Bros. approached
      <a href="/wiki/Wolfgang_Petersen" title="Wolfgang Petersen">
       Wolfgang Petersen
      </a>
      to direct
      <i>
       Superman: Flyby
      </i>
      ,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dynamic_101-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Dynamic-101">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        101
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      however, in August 2001,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-102">
       <a href="#cite_note-102">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        102
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Andrew_Kevin_Walker" title="Andrew Kevin Walker">
       Andrew Kevin Walker
      </a>
      pitched Warner Bros. an idea titled
      <i>
       Batman vs Superman
      </i>
      , attaching Petersen as director.
      <i>
       Superman: Flyby
      </i>
      was put on hold,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dynamic_101-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Dynamic-101">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        101
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Akiva_Goldsman" title="Akiva Goldsman">
       Akiva Goldsman
      </a>
      was hired to rewrite Walker's
      <i>
       Batman vs. Superman
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ass_85-2">
       <a href="#cite_note-ass-85">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        85
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      Goldsman's draft, dated June 21, 2002, had Bruce Wayne going through a
      <a href="/wiki/Mental_breakdown" title="Mental breakdown">
       mental breakdown
      </a>
      after his five-year retirement from crime fighting.
      <a href="/wiki/Dick_Grayson" title="Dick Grayson">
       Dick Grayson
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Pennyworth" title="Alfred Pennyworth">
       Alfred Pennyworth
      </a>
      and
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Commissioner_Gordon" title="Commissioner Gordon">
       Commissioner Gordon
      </a>
      are all dead, but Bruce finds some solace in his fiance, Elizabeth Miller. Meanwhile,
      <a href="/wiki/Clark_Kent" title="Clark Kent">
       Clark Kent
      </a>
      is struggling because of a recent divorce from
      <a href="/wiki/Lois_Lane" title="Lois Lane">
       Lois Lane
      </a>
      . Clark and Bruce are close friends, and Clark is Bruce's
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Wedding_ceremony_participants#Best_man" title="Wedding ceremony participants">
       best man
      </a>
      . After the Joker kills Elizabeth on their honeymoon, Bruce swears revenge, while Clark tries to hold him back. Bruce blames Clark for her death, and the two go against one another. Ultimately,
      <a href="/wiki/Lex_Luthor" title="Lex Luthor">
       Lex Luthor
      </a>
      is revealed to have masterminded the entire plot to get Batman and Superman to destroy each other. The two decide to team up and stop Luthor.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-103">
       <a href="#cite_note-103">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        103
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a href="/wiki/Christian_Bale" title="Christian Bale">
       Christian Bale
      </a>
      , who would play the character in
      <a href="/wiki/Christopher_Nolan" title="Christopher Nolan">
       Christopher Nolan
      </a>
      's
      <a href="/wiki/Batman_in_film#Christopher_Nolan_series" title="Batman in film">
       <i>
        Batman
       </i>
       film trilogy
      </a>
      , was simultaneously approached to portray Batman for
      <a href="/wiki/Darren_Aronofsky" title="Darren Aronofsky">
       Darren Aronofsky
      </a>
      's
      <i>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Batman:_Year_One_(canceled_film)" title="Batman: Year One (canceled film)">
        Batman: Year One
       </a>
      </i>
      ,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-104">
       <a href="#cite_note-104">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        104
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      while
      <a href="/wiki/Josh_Hartnett" title="Josh Hartnett">
       Josh Hartnett
      </a>
      was offered the role of Superman.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Stallville_100-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-Stallville-100">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        100
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <p>
      Filming was to start in early 2003, with plans for a five- to six-month shoot. The release date was set for the summer of 2004.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-105">
       <a href="#cite_note-105">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        105
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      However, Warner Bros. canceled development to focus on individual Superman and Batman projects after Abrams submitted another draft for
      <i>
       Superman: Flyby
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-.40.23.21.2A.25_106-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-.40.23.21.2A.25-106">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        106
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      According to Petersen "[Warner Bros.' chief] Alan Horn was so torn, because it's such a fascinating concept to do a Batman versus Superman film."
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-107">
       <a href="#cite_note-107">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        107
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      In the opening scene of
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/I_Am_Legend_(film)" title="I Am Legend (film)">
        I Am Legend
       </a>
      </i>
      , a billboard displays the Superman symbol within the Batman symbol in
      <a href="/wiki/Times_Square" title="Times Square">
       Times Square
      </a>
      . It is meant as an
      <a href="/wiki/In-joke" title="In-joke">
       in-joke
      </a>
      by the film's writer, Akiva Goldsman, who also wrote the script for
      <i>
       Batman vs. Superman
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-108">
       <a href="#cite_note-108">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        108
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Whedon_reboot">
       Whedon reboot
      </span>
     </h3>
     <p>
      <a href="/wiki/Joss_Whedon" title="Joss Whedon">
       Joss Whedon
      </a>
      pitched a rebooted
      <i>
       Batman
      </i>
      film in December 2002
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-109">
       <a href="#cite_note-109">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        109
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      using a villain specifically created for the film, which he described as "a
      <a href="/wiki/Hannibal_Lecter" title="Hannibal Lecter">
       Hannibal Lector
      </a>
      type - he was somebody already in Arkham Asylum that Bruce went and sort of studied with. Mine was a bit less epic. It was more about the progression of him and it was more in Gotham City. He didnt go to Tibet and meet cool people, but it was very similar in vibe [to Nolan's
      <i>
       Batman Begins
      </i>
      ]."
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-110">
       <a href="#cite_note-110">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        110
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Justice_League:_Mortal">
       <i>
        Justice League: Mortal
       </i>
      </span>
     </h3>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/Justice_League_in_other_media#Film" title="Justice League in other media">
       Justice League in other media  Film
      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      In February 2007, during pre-production for
      <i>
       The Dark Knight
      </i>
      , Warner Bros. hired husband and wife screenwriting duo Michelle and
      <a href="/wiki/Kieran_Mulroney" title="Kieran Mulroney">
       Kieran Mulroney
      </a>
      to script a
      <i>
       justice League
      </i>
      film
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-111">
       <a href="#cite_note-111">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        111
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      featuring a younger Batman in a separate franchise.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Kit_112-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Kit-112">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        112
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/D._J._Cotrona" title="D. J. Cotrona">
       D. J. Cotrona
      </a>
      was cast as Superman,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYT_113-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-NYT-113">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        113
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/George_Miller_(filmmaker)" title="George Miller (filmmaker)">
       George Miller
      </a>
      was hired to direct the following September,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYT_113-1">
       <a href="#cite_note-NYT-113">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        113
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      with
      <a href="/wiki/Armie_Hammer" title="Armie Hammer">
       Armie Hammer
      </a>
      cast as Batman a month later
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Canada_114-0">
       <a href="#cite_note-Canada-114">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        114
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-115">
       <a href="#cite_note-115">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        115
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Teresa_Palmer" title="Teresa Palmer">
       Teresa Palmer
      </a>
      as Talia al Ghul.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-116">
       <a href="#cite_note-116">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        116
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Filming had nearly commenced for at
      <a href="/wiki/Fox_Studios_Australia" title="Fox Studios Australia">
       Fox Studios Australia
      </a>
      in Sydney, but was pushed back over the
      <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_Writers_Guild_of_America_strike" title="200708 Writers Guild of America strike">
       Writer's Guild of America strike
      </a>
      , and once more when the
      <a href="/wiki/Australian_Film_Commission" title="Australian Film Commission">
       Australian Film Commission
      </a>
      denied Warner Bros. a 45 percent tax rebate over lack of Australian actors in the film.
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-117">
       <a href="#cite_note-117">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        117
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      Production offices were moved to
      <a href="/wiki/Vancouver_Film_Studios" title="Vancouver Film Studios">
       Vancouver Film Studios
      </a>
      in Canada for an expected July 2008 start and a planned summer 2009 theatrical release date,
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-118">
       <a href="#cite_note-118">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        118
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-119">
       <a href="#cite_note-119">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        119
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
      but Warner Bros. ultimately canceled
      <i>
       Justice League
      </i>
      following the success of
      <i>
       The Dark Knight
      </i>
      . Hammer's option on his contract lapsed and the studio was more willing to proceed with Christopher Nolan to finish his trilogy separately with
      <i>
       The Dark Knight Rises
      </i>
      .
      <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-120">
       <a href="#cite_note-120">
        <span>
         [
        </span>
        120
        <span>
         ]
        </span>
       </a>
      </sup>
     </p>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Animated_films">
       Animated films
      </span>
     </h2>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Batman_solo">
       Batman solo
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       1993:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Mask_of_the_Phantasm" title="Batman: Mask of the Phantasm">
         Mask of the Phantasm
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Animated_Series" title="Batman: The Animated Series">
         Batman: The Animated Series
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Kevin_Conroy" title="Kevin Conroy">
        Kevin Conroy
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       1998:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_%26_Mr._Freeze:_SubZero" title="Batman &amp; Mr. Freeze: SubZero">
         Subzero
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        Batman: The Animated Series
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2000:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_Beyond:_Return_of_the_Joker" title="Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker">
         Return of the Joker
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_Beyond" title="Batman Beyond">
         Batman Beyond
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Will_Friedle" title="Will Friedle">
        Will Friedle
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2003:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Mystery_of_the_Batwoman" title="Batman: Mystery of the Batwoman">
         Mystery of the Batwoman
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_New_Batman_Adventures" title="The New Batman Adventures">
         The New Batman Adventures
        </a>
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2005:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Batman_vs._Dracula" title="The Batman vs. Dracula">
         The Batman vs. Dracula
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Batman_(TV_series)" title="The Batman (TV series)">
         The Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Rino_Romano" title="Rino Romano">
        Rino Romano
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2010:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Under_the_Red_Hood" title="Batman: Under the Red Hood">
         Under the Red Hood
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Under_the_Hood" title="Batman: Under the Hood">
         Batman: Under the Hood
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Bruce_Greenwood" title="Bruce Greenwood">
        Bruce Greenwood
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2011:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Year_One_(film)" title="Batman: Year One (film)">
         Year One
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Year_One" title="Batman: Year One">
         Batman: Year One
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Benjamin_McKenzie" title="Benjamin McKenzie">
        Benjamin McKenzie
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2012:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Dark_Knight_Returns_(film)" title="Batman: The Dark Knight Returns (film)">
         The Dark Knight Returns - Part 1
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of the first half of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Dark_Knight_Returns" title="The Dark Knight Returns">
         The Dark Knight Returns
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Peter_Weller" title="Peter Weller">
        Peter Weller
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2013:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_The_Dark_Knight_Returns_(film)#Part_2" title="Batman: The Dark Knight Returns (film)">
         The Dark Knight Returns - Part 2
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of the second half of
       <i>
        The Dark Knight Returns
       </i>
       with Peter Weller voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2013:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Lego_Batman:_The_Movie_%E2%80%93_DC_Super_Heroes_Unite" title="Lego Batman: The Movie  DC Super Heroes Unite">
         DC Super Heroes Unite
        </a>
       </i>
       , an adaptation of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Lego_Batman_2:_DC_Super_Heroes" title="Lego Batman 2: DC Super Heroes">
         Lego Batman 2: DC Super Heroes
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Troy_Baker" title="Troy Baker">
        Troy Baker
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014:
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Son_of_Batman_(film)" title="Son of Batman (film)">
         Son of Batman
        </a>
       </i>
       , a loose adaptation of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman_and_Son" title="Batman and Son">
         Batman and Son
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Jason_O%27Mara" title="Jason O'Mara">
        Jason O'Mara
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Assault_on_Arkham" title="Batman: Assault on Arkham">
         Assault on Arkham
        </a>
       </i>
       , set in the continuity of
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Arkham" title="Batman: Arkham">
         Batman: Arkham
        </a>
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2015:
       <i>
        Batman vs. Robin
       </i>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="With_other_heroes">
       With other heroes
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       2008:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_The_New_Frontier" title="Justice League: The New Frontier">
         Justice League: The New Frontier
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on the
       <a href="/wiki/DC:_The_New_Frontier" title="DC: The New Frontier">
        comic of the same name
       </a>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Jeremy_Sisto" title="Jeremy Sisto">
        Jeremy Sisto
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2009:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Superman/Batman:_Public_Enemies" title="Superman/Batman: Public Enemies">
         Superman/Batman: Public Enemies
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on the comic of the same name with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2010:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_Crisis_on_Two_Earths" title="Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths">
         Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths
        </a>
       </i>
       , a loose adaptation of various DC comics with
       <a href="/wiki/William_Baldwin" title="William Baldwin">
        William Baldwin
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2010:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Superman/Batman:_Apocalypse" title="Superman/Batman: Apocalypse">
         Superman/Batman: Apocalypse
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        Superman/Batman: The Supergirl from Krypton
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2010:
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/DC_Super_Friends" title="DC Super Friends">
         DC Super Friends
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on the
       <a href="/wiki/Fisher-Price" title="Fisher-Price">
        Fisher-Price
       </a>
       toyline with
       <a href="/wiki/Daran_Norris" title="Daran Norris">
        Daran Norris
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2012:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_Doom" title="Justice League: Doom">
         Justice League: Doom
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/JLA:_Tower_of_Babel" title="JLA: Tower of Babel">
         JLA: Tower of Babel
        </a>
       </i>
       with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2013:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_The_Flashpoint_Paradox" title="Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox">
         Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Flashpoint_(comics)" title="Flashpoint (comics)">
         Flashpoint
        </a>
       </i>
       with
       <a href="/wiki/Kevin_McKidd" title="Kevin McKidd">
        Kevin McKidd
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/JLA_Adventures:_Trapped_in_Time" title="JLA Adventures: Trapped in Time">
         JLA Adventures: Trapped in Time
        </a>
       </i>
       , an original story with
       <a href="/wiki/Diedrich_Bader" title="Diedrich Bader">
        Diedrich Bader
       </a>
       voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_War" title="Justice League: War">
         Justice League: War
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        Justice League: Origin
       </i>
       with Jason O'Mara voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2015:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Justice_League:_Throne_of_Atlantis" title="Justice League: Throne of Atlantis">
         Justice League: Throne of Atlantis
        </a>
       </i>
       , based on
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Throne_of_Atlantis" title="Throne of Atlantis">
         Throne of Atlantis
        </a>
       </i>
       with Jason O'Mara voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2015:
       <i>
        Justice League: Gods and Monsters
       </i>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Other">
       Other
      </span>
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       2008:
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Batman:_Gotham_Knight" title="Batman: Gotham Knight">
         Batman: Gotham Knight
        </a>
       </i>
       , a collection of original shorts with Kevin Conroy voicing Batman
      </li>
      <li>
       2014: A
       <a href="/wiki/Lego" title="Lego">
        Lego
       </a>
       -themed version of Batman appears in
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/The_Lego_Movie" title="The Lego Movie">
         The Lego Movie
        </a>
       </i>
       , voiced by
       <a href="/wiki/Will_Arnett" title="Will Arnett">
        Will Arnett
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Cast_and_characters">
       Cast and characters
      </span>
     </h2>
     <div class="hatnote relarticle mainarticle">
      Main article:
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_Batman_films_cast_members" title="List of Batman films cast members">
       List of Batman films cast members
      </a>
     </div>
     <h2>
      <span class="mw-headline" id="Reception">
       Reception
      </span>
     </h2>
     <h3>

        <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
         <b>

           ^

        <span class="reference-text">
         <span class="citation web">
          Subers, Ray (September 4, 2012).
          <a class="external text" href="http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3514&amp;p=.htm" rel="nofollow">
           "Around-the-World Roundup: 'Dark Knight Rises' Joins Billionaire Club"
          </a>
          <span class="reference-accessdate">
           . Retrieved September 9, 2012
          </span>
          .

          </i>
          .

          from the original on October 14, 2008

   <h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" lang="en">
    <span dir="auto">
     Bob Kane
    </span>
   </h1>
   <div class="mw-body-content" id="bodyContent">
    <div id="siteSub">
     From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
    </div>
    <div id="contentSub">
    </div>
    <div class="mw-jump" id="jump-to-nav">
     Jump to:
     <a href="#mw-navigation">
      navigation
     </a>
     ,
     <a href="#p-search">
      search
     </a>
    </div>
    <div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en">
     <table cellspacing="3" class="infobox biography vcard" style="border-spacing:3px;width:22em;text-align: left; background: #fff;;">
      <tr>
       <th class="fn" colspan="2" style="text-align:center;font-size:125%;font-weight:bold;background: #99c2ff;;">
        Bob Kane
       </th>
      </tr>
      <tr>
       <td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Batman_Kane.jpg">
         <img alt="Batman Kane.jpg" data-file-height="250" data-file-width="298" height="193" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/00/Batman_Kane.jpg/230px-Batman_Kane.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/00/Batman_Kane.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/00/Batman_Kane.jpg 2x" width="230"/>
        </a>
        <div>
         Bob Kane with
         <a href="/wiki/Michael_Keaton" title="Michael Keaton">
          Michael Keaton
         </a>
         as
         <a href="/wiki/Batman" title="Batman">
          Batman
         </a>
         on the set of the 1989 film
         <i>
          <a href="/wiki/Batman_(1989_film)" title="Batman (1989 film)">
           Batman
          </a>
         </i>
         .
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
       <th scope="row" style="text-align:left;width: 40%;;">
        Born
       </th>
       <td>
        Robert Kahn
        <br/>
        <span style="display:none">
         (
         <span class="bday">
          1915-10-24
         </span>
         )
        </span>
        October 24, 1915
        <br/>
        <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">
         New York City
        </a>
        ,
        <a href="/wiki/New_York" title="New York">
         New York
        </a>
       </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
       <th scope="row" style="text-align:left;width: 40%;;">
        Died
       </th>
       <td>
        November 3, 1998
        <span style="display:none">
         (
         <span class="dday deathdate">
          1998-11-03
         </span>
         )
        </span>
        (aged83)
        <br/>
        <span class="deathplace">
         <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles" title="Los Angeles">
          Los Angeles
         </a>
         ,
         <a href="/wiki/California" title="California">
          California
         </a>
        </span>
       </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
       <th scope="row" style="text-align:left;width: 40%;;">
        Nationality
       </th>
       <td class="category">
        American
       </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
       <th scope="row" style="text-align:left;width: 40%;;">
        <span style="white-space:nowrap;">
         Area(s)
        </span>
       </th>
       <td class="role">
        Writer,
        <a href="/wiki/Penciller" title="Penciller">
         Penciller
        </a>
       </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
       <th scope="row" style="text-align:left;width: 40%;;">
        <div style="padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">
         Notable works
        </div>
       </th>
       <td>
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Batman_(comic_book)" title="Batman (comic book)">
          Batman
         </a>
        </i>
        <br/>
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Detective_Comics" title="Detective Comics">
          Detective Comics
         </a>
        </i>
       </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
       <th scope="row" style="text-align:left;width: 40%;;">
        <span style="white-space:nowrap;">
         Spouse(s)
        </span>
       </th>
       <td>
        Elizabeth Sanders (?-1998; his death)
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
     <p>
      <b>
       Bob Kane
      </b>
      (born
      <b>
       Robert Kahn
      </b>
      ; October 24, 1915  November 3, 1998) was an
      <a href="/wiki/Americans" title="Americans">
       American
      </a>
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Comic_book_creator" title="Comic book creator">
       comic book artist
      </a>
      , credited along with
      <a href="/wiki/Bill_Finger" title="Bill Finger">
       Bill Finger
      </a>
      as the creator of the
      <a href="/wiki/DC_Comics" title="DC Comics">
       DC Comics
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/Superhero" title="Superhero">
       superhero
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/Batman" title="Batman">
       Batman
      </a>
      . He was inducted into the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Comic-book" title="Comic-book">
       comic-book
      </a>
      industry's
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Jack_Kirby_Hall_of_Fame" title="Jack Kirby Hall of Fame">
       Jack Kirby Hall of Fame
      </a>
      in 1994 and into the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Will_Eisner_Award_Hall_of_Fame" title="The Will Eisner Award Hall of Fame">
       Will Eisner Comic Book Hall of Fame
      </a>
      in 1996.
     </p>
     <p>
     </p>
